author: {'steamid': '76561198091059294', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1701113675}
review:
Disney Pixar Cars ist ein Rennspiel, das auf dem beliebten Animationsfilm von Pixar basiert. Entwickelt von Rainbow Studios, bietet es eine unterhaltsame und charmante Spielerfahrung f√ºr Fans jeden Alters.

Grafik und Sound:
Die Grafik von Disney Pixar Cars ist bunt und lebendig, was den Stil des Films perfekt einf√§ngt. Die Fahrzeuge sind detailliert gestaltet und haben Pers√∂nlichkeit, w√§hrend die Rennstrecken abwechslungsreich und fantasievoll sind. Der Soundtrack des Spiels ist eing√§ngig und stimmungsvoll und wird durch passende Soundeffekte wie das Brummen der Motoren und das Quietschen der Reifen erg√§nzt, was zu einer lebendigen und immersiven Spielerfahrung beitr√§gt.

Spielmechanik:
Das Spiel bietet eine einfache und zug√§ngliche Spielmechanik, die sowohl f√ºr Gelegenheitsspieler als auch f√ºr erfahrene Rennspiel-Fans geeignet ist. Die Steuerung der Fahrzeuge ist pr√§zise und reaktionsschnell, was ein angenehmes Fahrgef√ºhl vermittelt. Es gibt verschiedene Spielmodi, darunter Einzelrennen, Zeitfahren und Mehrspielerrennen, die f√ºr Abwechslung sorgen und langfristigen Spielspa√ü bieten.

Charaktere und Handlung:
Ein herausragendes Merkmal von Disney Pixar Cars ist die Vielzahl an liebenswerten Charakteren aus dem Film, die im Spiel vorkommen. Spieler k√∂nnen bekannte Figuren wie Lightning McQueen, Mater und Sally steuern und sich mit ihnen auf spannende Rennen und Abenteuer begeben. Die Handlung des Spiels folgt grob der Handlung des Films und bietet verschiedene Herausforderungen und Rennstrecken, die von den ikonischen Orten des Films inspiriert sind.

Familienfreundlichkeit und Wiederspielbarkeit:
Disney Pixar Cars ist ein Spiel, das f√ºr die ganze Familie geeignet ist. Die niedlichen Charaktere, die einfache Spielmechanik und die kindgerechte Pr√§sentation machen es zu einem idealen Spiel f√ºr j√ºngere Spieler, w√§hrend es gleichzeitig genug Tiefe und Herausforderung bietet, um auch erwachsene Spieler zu unterhalten. Die Wiederspielbarkeit des Spiels wird durch die verschiedenen Spielmodi und freischaltbaren Inhalte sichergestellt, die es zu entdecken gilt.

Fazit:
Disney Pixar Cars ist ein unterhaltsames und charmantes Rennspiel, das die Magie des Films auf die Bildschirme bringt. Mit seiner farbenfrohen Grafik, dem eing√§ngigen Soundtrack und der zug√§nglichen Spielmechanik bietet es Spa√ü f√ºr die ganze Familie. Fans des Films werden die Gelegenheit genie√üen, ihre Lieblingscharaktere zu steuern und auf bekannten Rennstrecken zu fahren, w√§hrend auch Spieler, die neu in der Welt von Cars sind, das Spiel genie√üen werden. Insgesamt ist Disney Pixar Cars ein gelungenes Rennspiel, das Jung und Alt gleicherma√üen begeistern wird.

review: Don't get me wrong this game is absolutely FANTASTIC. Grew up playing it and it is one of the best games out there at the time, it still is one of my favorite to this very day. But the thing is that this port sucks, it can't run properly on modern systems without some kind of emulation. If you are okay with that, go for it, you won't regret it. But my crappy laptop can't really handle the emulation, so I'm left with nothing but tears and memories of the good ole days :')

review: Recommended ages 5-10.  If your child loves the Disney CARS movies, this will be a great purchase.  My now six year-old typically just drives around and crashes into other cars and finds that satisfying, but to advance through the game, your child will probably need some adult assistance - the quests are a little difficult to follow and are surprisingly technical at times for a game geared for children.

review: This game is very fun and its impresive considering its age.It is an open world i could say and you are going around as mcqeen while getting into races and side quests. The story qut scenes are nicely voiced and there has been put a lot of care. You are going to encounter familiar faces and lore that will get you excited.Also in some misions you get to play and with other familiar characters. Of course isnt everything great since there is some bugs here and there but i belive they apear because i play on windows 11 and the game was made for older ones. I recoment it to anyone who loves the cars series cause its a masterpiece!

author: {'steamid': '76561199240145181', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1704037507}
review:
Holy! Playing this game with a keyboard instead of a wacky PS2 controller made everything a cakewalk...
The game is still as good as it used to be.

I did have to look up and fix the game crashing when entering anything other than tipping tractors but it is easly fixable just by replacing that scenes.pak file (you can find a steam guide on it too: https://steamcommunity.com/app/331160/discussions/0/1679189548066508837)

And I did have some issues with the game not synchronizing with the steam cloud at all and steam harassing me about it but, it's most likely a me issue.

The game overall is still an 8/10

But for the nostalgia factor it bumps it up to 20/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198252700156', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 136677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 16563, 'playtime_at_review': 113686, 'last_played': 1712455252}
review:
My dear aficionados of digital delight, allow me to regale you with an exhaustive exploration of the unparalleled opus that is the 2006 Disney Pixar Cars video game. As a connoisseur of the highest order, I must confess that my expertise in this domain knows no bounds, for I have traversed the winding roads of Radiator Springs and beyond more times than I dare to count. With a playtime that ranks among the top 5 worldwide, I stand as a testament to the enduring allure and unyielding brilliance of this magnum opus.

Let us embark upon this odyssey of enlightenment by immersing ourselves in the symphonic splendor of gameplay mechanics crafted with the precision of a master artisan. Rainbow Studios, in their infinite wisdom, have bestowed upon us a cornucopia of racing dynamics that rival the most exalted works of art. Each drift, each boost, is executed with the elegance and finesse of a virtuoso pianist caressing the keys of a grand piano. The open-world environment, a veritable playground of possibility, beckons players to lose themselves in its labyrinthine intricacies, uncovering hidden secrets and embarking upon epic quests with the zeal of intrepid explorers.

But let us not merely scratch the surface of this veritable treasure trove of digital delights, for the narrative opulence that saturates every fiber of this opus demands our undivided attention. In the grand tradition of the finest storytelling, the game weaves a tapestry of plotlines that intertwine seamlessly with the beloved narrative of the movie. Yet, it is in the exploration of new territories and the introduction of fresh challenges that the game truly distinguishes itself. Each character, from the indomitable Lightning McQueen to the irrepressibly eccentric Mater, is rendered with such depth and nuance that one cannot help but be ensnared by their charms, their trials, and triumphs becoming our own.

And what of the legacy of this magnum opus, you may ask? Ah, dear interlocutor, the legacy is as illustrious as the game itself, for it has left an indelible mark on the annals of gaming history. Its influence reverberates through the industry, inspiring emulation and innovation in equal measure. From the tender embrace of nostalgia to the relentless pursuit of innovation, the game continues to captivate audiences of all ages, its enduring appeal a testament to the boundless creativity and artistry of the human spirit.

In conclusion, the 2006 Disney Pixar Cars video game stands not merely as a triumph of entertainment, but as a testament to the enduring power of imagination and innovation. It is a symphony of sight and sound, a veritable feast for the senses that leaves an indelible impression on all who dare to partake. In the grand tapestry of gaming, it shines as a radiant jewel, a beacon of hope and inspiration in a world fraught with uncertainty and doubt. Let us raise our controllers high in salute to this illustrious masterpiece, for its brilliance shall continue to illuminate our lives for generations to come.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135464204', 'num_games_owned': 920, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1699150970}
review:
i dont think words can truly articulate what this game ultimately means to me. 

not for the game itself, god no, but for the memories its provided me with over the years.

i originally experienced this game via the demo on xbla marketplace on my brother's old jasper xbox 360, and i mostly just piddled about doing not much of anything in that demo, but it stuck with me. the theme of this game haunted me for years, because i could never remember what game it was actually from.

fast forward a few years, and a friend of mine brings up this game in passing, saying that he owned it on ps2, and we both discover that it has not only a pc port, but bafflingly, a steam release of said pc port. we find this rather humorous, and he proceeds to buy it. we had an uproarious night of fun, taking the piss out of the game, dogging on it, glitch hunting, and just both re-experiencing this fractured piece of our childhoods together.

forward a few more years, to this very year, the space year of 2023. i have convinced another dear friend of mine to attempt to play cars, entirely on a whim due to the unavailability of another game he wanted to play at the time. what ensued was a four-day streak of utter chaos and madness, wherein the game refused to co-operate with everything he attempted to do, from basic controls, to sound settings, to graphical oddities, glitches, poorly explained mechanics, awful minigames, the whole gamut of just absolutely mediocre licensed game trappings from the 2000s. and in spite of that, or arguably because of it, we had a god-damned blast. we were screaming in call, going nuts over how much the game sucked, over how execrable many of the choices were, turning down every sound setting except for the dialogue to make sure we got the richest owen wilson experience possible. 

this game has given me many a lovely memory, and for that, i can't help but be positively skewed towards it. objectivity has never been my strong suit, and this is no exception. 

disney pixar's cars is a godawful video game and i love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199498143252', 'num_games_owned': 37, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1699403596}

author: {'steamid': '76561198114305814', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1701208782}
review:
Maybe I'm looking through nostalgia glasses, but this game is still worth playing today, IF you liked the Cars movie and enjoy racing. The game is basically an extension of the first movie, and has extra Doc (Patrick Newman) lines! Kinda wild, actors back in the day didn't think they could ask for that much to be in the game, so they have a lot of the cast in here. I haven't finished the game ever, started when I was a kid and gonna finish now 12 years later
The game is probably best played on a CRT

review: This game was a large part of my childhood. The gameplay is good, if very easy for people over the age of 10, though if you enter "CHMPION" as your profile name, the game will be at least somewhat harder. Also, they removed the deleted scenes and clips from the film in this version, even though you can still technically spend points to unlock them, so be careful there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009584499', 'num_games_owned': 1403, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1693503431}
review:
[h1][b]Content[/b][/h1]
[b]Rating: 20/20[/b]

Cars is a racing video game based on the movie of the same name. The story mode consists of roughly 50 races of various types and lengths. In total, the game should take 6-8 hours to complete. The arcade mode allows you to play through everything the story mode offers in an arcade fashion. The extras section offers additional things to mess around with, such as clips and art. In total, this is a very decent 10-hour experience.

[h1][b]Gameplay[/b][/h1]
[b]Rating: 16/20[/b]

The gameplay in Cars is refreshingly simple. It incorporates familiar elements found in other racing games but with added twists like jumping, reverse driving, and other unique antics not typically seen in traditional racing titles. Aside from pure racing events, mini-games offer a lot of fun with character-specific missions. Other events include head-to-head challenges, piston cup races, or short new gameplay mechanic learning experiences. Driving is fun, and you get to experience and use all of the gameplay mechanics right through the end of the game. The only issue I've had is the amount of objects you can't jump over, but other than that, it was an excellent driving experience. The game provides a world map that isn't very useful apart from showing the locations and events and a driving minimap. Sadly, the driveable roads only appear during events and are missing during free-roam gameplay. Fortunately, this isn't overly concerning since the game world isn't complicated. Nevertheless, having the roads visible would prove highly advantageous while searching for Lizzie's postcards.

[h1][b]Presentation[/b][/h1]
[b]Rating: 10/20[/b]

When the game launched in 2006, there were many racing games that looked and played better compared to this release. But what the other racing games don't have is a Cars-themed racing experience. However, the game falls flat in many areas graphically. Sadly, the game suffers from graphical glitches all over the place. The characters' eyes, for instance, are depicted with constantly present black spots, while the car models showcase an array of graphical anomalies. Although these glitches remain absent during typical gameplay, they significantly detract from the overall presentation quality. The graphics feel dated, especially when looking at areas from distant elevated portions of the map. The soundtrack isn't vast, but the tracks that do play during gameplay are enjoyable and fit the game perfectly. Sound effects are cartoon-like and complement the rest of the presentation nicely. The UI and menu elements do feel dated, but considering the age of the game, they don't take away much from the enjoyment.

[h1][b]Story[/b][/h1]
[b]Rating: 7/20[/b]

Disney-Pixar Cars lets you relive the film's excitement in a thrilling race to the finish line as you take on the role of Lightning McQueen and other beloved characters. This story-based adventure recreates pivotal movie moments and offers an open-world environment with 50+ races, making it more than just a typical racing game. While the story isn't as interesting or exciting for the older demographics, being able to jump into the world of Cars and drive around without limitations is as much fun, if not even more so, as following the storyline.

[h1][b]Technicalities[/b][/h1]
[b]Rating: 10/20[/b]

One of the most problematic things about this game is its 30 FPS lock. On its own, this doesn't sound too bad. However, the amount of motion sickness while steering is worrisome. Besides the 30 FPS lock, there are no performance issues. The loading screens are short, and entering a new section of the map does cause a load screen.

[h1][b]Final Verdict[/b][/h1]
[b]Rating: 63/100[/b]

Cars is a game I played as a kid years ago on the PlayStation 2, and playing through it again all these years later felt both nostalgic and emotional as the floodgates of memories started pouring down in each and every minute of my playthrough. Even if you're not a kid anymore, this game's going to make you feel like one again, and it's worth it.

Gallo Pinto Costarricense

Ingredientes
3 cucharadas de aceite de canola
1/4 cebolla picada
1/2 pimiento verde (o rojo) en cuadraditos
3 tazas de frijoles rojos o negros, cocidos
3 tazas de arroz blanco, cocido
1. pizca de Sal
2 cucharadas de culantro picado

Instrucciones
1. Calienta el aceite en una sart√©n grande y fr√≠e la cebolla y el pimiento hasta que est√©n suaves.
2. Agrega los frijoles, bien escurridos, y fr√≠e de tres a cinco minutos. Agrega un poco del caldo de cocci√≥n, si ves que est√°n quedando muy secos.
3. Incorpora el arroz y sigue friendo unos tres minutos m√°s agregando un poco m√°s de caldo de frijoles para que el gallo pinto no quede muy seco y finalmente adorna con culantro picado.

¬°Pura Vida!

author: {'steamid': '76561198097879609', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1635796119}
review:
[h1] TLDR: 7/10 One of the rare video game adaptations that are actually good! [/h1]

[b] Actual Review (No Spoilers): [/b] This game was part of the era that was riddled with low budget movie-to-game adaptations and it ended up being surprisingly good. An open world cars game with an original story makes for a really fun experience. There are side quests to complete and skins for McQueen to unlock. You can also play as a handful of different characters from the movie as well.

The driving itself is really smooth and the controls are easy to master. There are multiple different maps for you to explore around, finding collectibles and the like. And even if this game was made for 10 year old kids, it's still a great, turn-off-your-brain type game that you can just drive around in with zero thoughts.

Also, because this game is made for kids, it's super easy to complete. The only annoyance is because this game is so old, It doesn't run the best on modern systems and there is a decent chance of crashes or some game breaking bugs such as your save file being corrupted. But I finished this game in like 3 play sessions so it wasn't a huge deal for me. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561199507189113', 'num_games_owned': 86, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1685201599}
review:
Pretty decent game for Cars, falls short of Race-O-Rama and Mater-National though.
Graphics are pretty bad for 2006 and the game did crash once. Occasional artifacting around the characters and shadows.
Game takes about 3.5 hours start to finish and is relatively easy to pick up.
Would recommend for ~$4 USD but no more

author: {'steamid': '76561198974885676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1684801307}
review:
Reliving my childhood with this amazing game. Though there are a few small flaws that can be fixed easily, which I will get to in a moment, amazing 9.5/10 (the ,5 is said flaws)
1. The game crashes on play immediately first log on. There is a YouTube video to fix it and get the game working immediately. IT HAD A GOOGLE DRIVE LINK.
2. The controls when you start are tough to get used to. Thankfully I changed mine to be more easy. The only part you can't change is the Tractor Tipping controls ;(
Here's some advice for controls:
I use WASD for driving, space for drifting, enter for powerslide, backspace for map, right arrow for boost, and C for backwards.
3. The cutscenes and videos don't work for me in the theater. But that's the least of my concerns.

Minus 1 and 3, phenomenal title. I love how this one allows open-world exploring in Radiator Springs, Ornament Valley and Tailfin Pass.

review:
It's a functional port of a game I grew up with on the PS2 that's pretty decent and has shockingly good licensed music in it, but I would probably bust out the PS2 version instead of trying to configure the controls in this version alongside the noticable pop in, Z-fighting and wobbly polygons on eyelids.

Please let me know if there's a fix for these issues.

review:
Literally just bought this game since i played it on the Wii 
If nothing else buy it found the sound track, It's too good for what amounts to a shovelware game on the Wii
Playing this game as an adult had made me realize how easy this game is, If anyone is looking to play this game again i recommend putting in the cheat code to unlock hard mode
Cheat code:CHMPION
Overall i finished this game in about 7 hours however 1-2 of those was looking for lizzies postcards but if you remember where they are it shouldnt take too long
Also as a warning, when i played this on my steam deck none of the videos would play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045093548', 'num_games_owned': 1895, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1676848292}
review:
So far this game is pretty bad. Overall it's a very bad port. The controls are awful. You can change the controls but the menu to remap them label the controls with generic button names rather than the human names. You can't map the menu controls so B is select while X is the back button. Sometimes the Y is the select button. It's all over the place. The main menu darkens the whole screen for no reason. Looking around is bad and there is no way to look behind you. The graphics are at a very low resolution, it looks like 480p, way worst than what the screenshots have you believe. There is no option to go to the Windows Desktop and changes your whole computer to make the UI bigger.

It's surprising to see this games has very positive reviews.

author: {'steamid': '76561198307424362', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1678144572}
review:
my life has been consistently going downhill lately, so I bought this game to dip my toes into some nostalgia, hoping it would help.

And boy howdy it did :')
Everything is as I remember, and it's almost perfect. 
 - The soundtrack has no reason to go as hard as it does in this game, oh my god
 - The pseudo open world is fun to explore, with tons of little secret paths that hold collectables and ramps for you to launch yourself from
 - The races are fun and the mini-games don't feel like they're being forced onto you, (as they can get very tedious very quick)
 - The animation was surprisingly good for a licensed game from 2006, and had some actually solid line delivery that got a laugh out of me sometimes!

obviously there's stuff that bugged me as a kid and still bugs me now, but I'm happy to say there's not really any new complaints?
 - The controls are absolutely terrible, but despite me playing this game *ON MY KEYBOARD*, i became accustomed to them after a bit of playing around
 - The graphics are awful, there are some pretty terrible pop in issues, texture glitches and more, but it doesn't make the game unplayable whatsoever
 - The "boss" races were boring and I expected more considering how fun some of the base missions were to play
 - The price on this just isn't worth it,, so I got it while 70% off and I think that price is fully worth it!
 
This game meant a lot to me growing up, and it still means a lot to me now. Feels weird to say but this game will forever hold a special place in my heart

7/10, a weirdly competent open world arcade racing game with a lot of charm :')


EDIT: Make a new profile called CHMPION to play the game on its hardest difficulty if you want more game time!

author: {'steamid': '76561198351974665', 'num_games_owned': 729, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1709956500}
review: My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead‚Äì murdered by my brother-in-law, Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now, and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, he asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded. I... I always thought Hank was a very moral man, and I was particularly vulnerable at the time ‚Äì something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me in on a ride-along and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin, so I agreed. Hank had a partner, a businessman named Gustavo Fring. Hank sold me into servitude to this man. And when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling-out. Things escalated. Fring was able to arrange ‚Äì uh, I guess... I guess you call it a "hit" ‚Äì on Hank, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured. And I wound up paying his medical bills, which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge. Working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring. The bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA. To keep me in line, he took my children. For three months, he kept them. My wife had no idea of my criminal activities, and was horrified to learn what I had done. I was in hell. I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. All I could think to do was to make this video and hope that the world will finally see this man for what he really is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198874652075', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 862, 'last_played': 1680387375}
review:
Gra prawdopodobnie nie przypadnie do gustu typowemu "normikowi". Do polubienia jej trzeba byc bowiem czlowiekiem nadto inteligentnym oraz miec wyrafinowany gust. Jak wiemy seria Auta zebrala nietuzinkowe grono spolecznosci i fanow, ktorzy sa ludzmi powaznymi, przezabawnymi, jak rowniez skromnymi.

Mniej i bardziej znane postaci z filmu jako przeciwnicy w wyscigach? - Genialne! Trasy po dobrze Nam znanych okolicach sa bardzo przyjaznym doswiadczeniem. Pozwala to na blizsze poznanie okolicy, o ktorym moglismy jedynie pomarzyc podczas wcinania popcornu przed wielkim ekranem w kinie, badz domowym zaciszu. Jazda trzeba przyznac - dosyc realistyczna. Zabawnym dodatkiem jest mozliwosc jazdy tylem oraz na "boku" (2 kolach). Idealnym dopelnieniem beda nocne jazdy po Chlodnicy Gorskiej, kiedy ulice sa prawie puste, poniewaz wszystkie samochody spia, prawda? Haha! Jezeli jezdzil ktos tak w zyciu realnym *musi* sprobowac tego tutaj! Porownywalne odczucia.

Gre z calego serca goraco polecam - dawno tak swietnie sie nie bawilem! Nie zaluje zadnej minuty, ani grosza, ktory zainwestowalem w te produkcje.

Pozdrawiam

review:
Buen juego, la versi√≥n de pc tiene peores gr√°ficos y modelos que la versi√≥n de xbox360. Con toda la furia tardaras en pasarte la historia unas 3 o 4 horas y en completarlo al 100% unas 8.
Para el minijuego de voltear tractores recomiendo modificar los controles a fin de una mayor comodidad.
El nivel mas dif√≠cil a mi parecer es el de Mate en el derby. La inteligencia va a una mayor velocidad y deber√°s practicar varias veces la conducci√≥n que nunca termina de ser c√≥moda ya que el freno de mano no termina de agarrarse al piso.
Tiene varios bugs como es de esperarse, para un juego de una pel√≠cula del 2006, que no afectan negativamente a la jugabilidad, en ciertas zonas podes aprovechar los errores de colisiones para saltar exageradamente y saltarte algunas zonas de las carreras o llegar mas r√°pido a distintas zonas.
Buena historia y que deja un buen desenlace dando paso al Cars: Mater-National (Precuela de Cars: Race-O-Rama)

author: {'steamid': '76561199054120452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1706309250}
review:
BEFORE READING: If you want to play this game, GO GET THE XBOX 360 OR WII VERSION!

This version of Cars is the Gamecube/OG Xbox/PS2 release. it does not have the definitive graphical experience, it does have all the content, even if locked behind cheat codes. This version also has some weird texture glitches and issues with 4x antialiasing option in the settings. It plays just fine even with a keyboard.  It's about 4-5 hours long and has a ton of extra unlockable content, it is absolutely worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198846448203', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 1036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1707825482}
review:
Uma OBRA DE ARTE que envelheceu como vinho!!!

Gameplay similar com a dos need for speed antigos, bem diferente dos novos jogos copias de mario kart.

Historia que vai de acordo com o filme, como uma sequencia, tem seus altos e mais altos pq esse jogo √© impecavel

Graficos meio datados por ser um jogo de 2006, mas tem op√ß√µes de textura em HD (n√£o s√£o todas) anima√ß√µes legais, colora√ß√£o bem bonitinha, algo bem da epoca mesmo.

Pre√ßo de banana em promo√ß√£o (at√© fora) recomendo pra todos que gostam do filme, ou de jogos de ps2 nesse estilo, ou pra quem gosta de joguinhos de corrida legais pra passar o tempo

Miss√µes divertidas, circuitos interessantes, e a dificuldade do game PRA MIM √© o ponto que mais deixa a desejar no jogo, pra mim que sou acostumado com esse tipo de jogo, √© estupidamente facil, todas as corridas eu ganho com 1min de vantagem do segundo lugar.
Mas tenho amigos que n√£o s√£o acostumados com esse estilo de jogo e sofrem um pouco kkkkk, mas com pouquissimo tempo j√° conseguem passar dos bots do jogo, ent√£o a IA √© o ponto mais bobo do jogo, que faz as "corridas" parecerem um time trial, pq tu n√£o v√™ ninguem na corrida inteira,

de resto, recomendo pra MUITO a todos, otimo game, confia na call ;)

review: This was the on of if not THE FIRST, video game I ever played. If you never played this game and you like the Cars franchise, play it. It gives me so much nostalgia from when i was like 8 playing this game on my ps2. The graphics aren't great (obviously) but it's got a couple hours of gameplay and A LOT of replayability. The CPU's are very easy to beat given it's a kids game, but i love it. 10/10 will always replay this about every year :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198830770575', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1667949133}
review:
This game is one of of the few memories of my childhood I can actually remember. I used to love playing this game on the good ol' Windows XP my dad made for my brother and I. I got thinking of my younger years yesterday and decided to see if I was able to relive those days. I looked the game up and sure enough the whole game waiting for me on Steam. When I was younger it took me forever just to realize what I needed to do in the game to continue the story, but the second I bought it today I was racing all over to get everything I need (Boost Juice, Powersliding, etc.). This game is an amazing racing game with a good post-movie story. 

If you ask me, the graphics aren't half bad for a 2006 game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198450904607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1705679232}
review:
Disney Cars Pixar: Juego proveniente de la Play Station II. Nostalgia ante todo.

Dise√±o grafico: 7/10 - Pongo esta puntuacion ya que, el juego como ya antes mencionado, es proveniente de la play 2. No estan mal, pero hay algunas fallas graficas en lo que viene siendo el transfondo de las texturas de texturizado.

Paleta de colores: 8/10 - Pongo esta puntuacion ya que, es bastante buena, viendo desde cuando es el juego. No es ni muy buena, ni muy mala. Es aceptable y clara hacia los ojos de cualquier persona, muy buenos colores, aunque yo le agregaria mas detalles.

Historia y Transfondo: 9.32/10 - Pongo esta puntuacion ya que, tiene muy buen desarrollo en la trama de la historia, es muy atrapante, te guia muy bien y tambien se vincula mucho con las 3 peliculas provenientes del juego. Yo le agregaria un final un poco mas cerrado pero me encanto.

Jugabilidad y Manejo de controles: 7.59/10 - Pongo esta puntuacion ya que, la jugabilidad y manejo de todos los autos que contiene este titulo, son manejables para cualquier tipo de persona, que no tenga ni idea de un juego de carreras. Yo le agregaria un poco mas de realismo al giro del mismo, pero como es un juego antiguo se lo perdona, por eso esta aprobado.

Menu de Opciones: 8.37/10 - Pongo esta puntuacion ya que, el menu es muy muy intuitivo, te guia por lo que necesites y te ayuda para lo que no entiendas. Es lindo, es simple y es facil de usar. Yo lo que le mejoraria serian mas opciones a la hora de cambio de controles.

Desenlace: Recomiendo mucho este juego, para las horas muertas que no sabes que jugar o hacer. Es muy entretenido intuitivo y facil, Ademas no pide mucho, como motor grafico esta bastante bien, siendo un juego proveniente del a√±o 2008.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072661514', 'num_games_owned': 4020, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 707, 'last_played': 1645048679}
review:
[h1]Genre[/h1]
Ein kinderfreundliches Rennspiel mit Open World Elementen im Cars Franchise.

[h1]Spielzeit[/h1]
Etwa 12 Stunden um alles freizuschalten. F√ºr die reine Story vielleicht ca. 4 Stunden.
Beendet am 16.02.2022.

[h1]Story[/h1]
Man spielt den aus den Disney‚Ä¢Pixar Cars Filmen bekannten Rennwagen Lightning McQueen (bis auf wenige Ausnahmen). Nachdem McQueen aus einem Tagtraum erwacht, m√∂chte er erneut am Piston Cup teilnehmen. Um in der Saison mithalten zu k√∂nnen, muss er aber zun√§chst trainieren. Dabei helfen ihm seine Freunde  und man erlernt so in verschiedenen Mini Spielen und Rennen alle m√∂glichen Techniken, wie Powerslide. Die Story wird dabei in kurzen Cutscense erz√§hlt und bleibt dabei recht oberfl√§chlich. Im Grunde geht es hier nur darum, von Rennen zu Rennen zu kommen.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Das Spiel besteht aus insgesamt 5 Kapiteln, wobei jedes aus 4 bis 8 Events besteht. Diese Events sind Stra√üenrennen, Minispiele und Piston Cup Rennen. In den Stra√üenrennen f√§hrt man drei Runden gegen andere Autos auf unterschiedlichsten Strecken. In den Minispielen muss man unterschiedlichste Aufgaben erf√ºllen, wie Traktoren erschrecken oder in einer bestimmten Zeit Gegenst√§nde finden. In den Piston Cup Rennen muss man mit bis zu 20 Teilnehmern 12 Runden in einem Stadion im Oval fahren. In der Mitte des Rennens muss man noch einen Boxenstopp machen, das als ein kleines Minispiel gestaltet ist. Neben der Hauptstory kann man insgesamt 250 Troph√§en erlangen, indem man alle Minispiele bis zum h√∂chsten Level schafft und in allen Rennen erster wird. Um die Story durchzuspielen, barucht man aber nur einen Bruchteil davon. Zudem kann man in der Welt Bonuspunkte einsammeln, um Fahrzeuge und Lackierungen f√ºr den Arcade Modus und einige Bonusinhalte (Bilder, Videos) freizuschalten.
Die verschiedenen Minispiele und Rennen sind √ºber die ganze Spielwelt verteilt, in der man sich v√∂llig frei bewegen kann. Im Laufe der Story schaltet man neben dem Startgebiet (Radiator Springs) noch zwei weitere Gebiete frei, in denen man sich dann ebenfalls frei bewegen kann.
Neben dem Story-Modus gibt es noch den Arcade-Modus, in dem man alle Rennen und Minispiele, die man im Story-Modus freigeschaltet hat mit unterschiedlichen Charakteren spielen kann. Zudem gibt es noch einen VS-Modus, in dem man mit einem zweiten Spieler im Split-Screen Rennen gegeneinander fahren kann.

[h1]Technik[/h1]
Die Grafik ist f√ºr ein Spiel von 2006 immer noch ansehnlich und ich konnte keinerlei technische Probleme unter Windows 10 feststellen. Die Steuerung kann mit Tastatur oder Controller erfolgen, wobei ich definitiv den Controller empfehle (am betsen einen Xbox360-Controller).

[h1]Achievements[/h1]
Das Spiel hat 250 Troph√§en, die man Ingame erlangen kann. Leider aber keine Steam Errungenschaften. Die meisten Troph√§en lassen sich ziemlich einfach erlangen. Ein paar wenige sind aber recht schwierig, da das ein oder andere Minispiel in den h√∂heren Levels recht knifflig wird und manche Objekte, die man in der Welt finden muss nur durch sehr schwer auszuf√ºhrende Spr√ºnge zu erreichen sind.

[h1]Pro/Contra[/h1]
+ leichtg√§ngiges kurzweiliges Gameplay
+ kinderfreundlich
+ recht schicke Grafik
+ gute Lizenzumsetzung, mit voller deutscher Synchronisation
+ sch√∂ne Mini Spiele

- Ingame Troph√§en, aber keine Steam Errungenschaften
- keine Steam Sammelkarten
- Rennen sind irgendwann etwas eint√∂nen, da wenig Abwechslung

[h1]Fazit[/h1]
Disney‚Ä¢Pixar Cars ist ein sch√∂nes kurzweiliges Rennspiel in einer kleinen quasi Open World. Fans der Cars Filme kommen hier auf jeden Fall auf ihre Kosten, da man hier diverse Figuren aus den Spielen treffen und teilweise auch spielen kann. Die Welt ist atmosp√§hrisch gestaltet und das Erkunden macht auch einige Zeit Spa√ü, auch wenn hier alles recht einfach gehalten ist. Durch die Troph√§en, die man erlangen kann, hat man noch eine gewisse Spiel-Motivation, auch √ºber die eigentliche Story hinaus. Mich hat das Spiel die 12 Spielstunden durchaus begeistern und motivieren k√∂nnen, danach ist aber die Luft raus, da man wirklich alles gesehen hat. F√ºr Kinder im Grundschulalter ist das Spiel auch sehr gut geeignet - meinem Sohn hat es auf jeden Fall auch gut gefallen.

review:
i liked this game car (2006). enjoyed my 15 hours- but it crashed quite often (and i cant find RUSTBUCKET RACE-O-RAMA.) my favorite part was the voice actors. i liked when McQueen would crash into things and exclaim "Ow!" and similar things, haha, KaChow, pretty funny. I also enjoyed the idle voice lines, like McQueen yawning because he's VERY eepy. Overall, I heavily recommend this game to any KaChowers (like me), because even though this was intended for children, it is still VERY EXTREMELY challenging. There's also cutscenes so thats pretty awesomesauce. Recommended, Adi√≥s...

PS. I dont really recommend buying the Car package Steam offers since the other two games featured in the package.. to put it lightly, they SUCK, Bad, Bad, Good. (and dont feature the VAs.)

review: You know how every now and then a video game based on a movie comes out and it's better then it has any right to be? This is one of those. If you liked the first Cars movie to any degree, you'll probably like this. If you were perplexed that Cars 2 followed Mater and sidelined Lightning McQueen, they you will like this one. It's pretty much the unofficial Cars sequel, from before there was a sequel. Is it perfect? No. But it's a decent racing game, with a free roam map with every place from the movie, and a pretty good fleshed out world for everywhere around it.

review:
Esse jogo √© muito divertido! Joguei ele por bastante tempo no PS2 e agora joguei novamente no PC, conclui a hist√≥ria novamente e foi muito divertido.
O jogo d√° continuidade ao enredo do primeiro filme. Aqui temos o Rel√¢mpago participando de uma nova Copa Pist√£o, a de 2006 (a do filme √© a Copa Pist√£o 2005) enquanto ajuda as pessoas da cidade de Radiator Springs com algumas quest√µes, e tamb√©m corridas.
O jogo √© de mundo aberto e tem todos os personagens do primeiro filme pra voc√™ interagir ou que aparecem em algum ponto da hist√≥ria. Voc√™ pode explorar Radiator Springs e as redondezas, inclusive v√°rios pontos que vemos no filme. O game foi bem fiel √† anima√ß√£o.
Infelizmente a vers√£o Steam n√£o tem vers√£o em Portugu√™s do Brasil, que existe. Eu baixei um mod para adicionar essa vers√£o, que traz os dubladores do filme para quase todos os personagens. As √∫nicas trocas que eu notei foram do Rei (ele s√≥ aparece no modo de corridas fora do modo hist√≥ria), Doc Hudson e Sally (que no filme original eram Star Talents, mas a partir do segundo filme, Sally fica com a mesma dubladora que dublou ela nesse jogo) e Luigi (que no filme era o Garcia Jr, aqui no jogo parece ser o Marco Ribeiro.
O jogo foi uma experi√™ncia maravilhosa, e √© o primeiro de uma trilogia de jogos que d√£o continuidade aos acontecimentos do filme. Vou atr√°s dos outros jogos. Aqui no Steam infelizmente s√≥ tem este e o segundo jogo, que √© o Mater-national championship. O terceiro, que √© Race-o-rama, n√£o tem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082419386', 'num_games_owned': 3652, 'num_reviews': 375, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1655637568}
review:
Disney's Cars is an adventure-racing game, where you play as Lightning McQueen and you want to win the Piston Cup.

The game plays after the first movie, has it's characters, look and sound from it, including the voice actors from the movie, which adds a lot to the game, it's more authentic in general. The length of the game can be adjusted from the menu: if you want to go around of the Cars' world and play most of the story and optional missions, you can try the full experience, but if you just want to play the important objectives only, you can try the short version, which is pretty good in my opinion. You can play with the game easily, you can get used to the controls nicely. Basic gameplay contains racing and minigames, which is simple but exciting sometimes. After beating the game, you can unlock lot of additional contents, like scrapped scenes from the Cars movie, liveries for different characters or trailers.

However, Cars has some issues, one of them is the difficulty: in general, the game is really easy, for those who played a racing game before you can beat this with minor difficulties, but those who is into racing games, this won't give any challenge at all. There is a Champion difficulty in the game, however in that, in races the opponents tends to rubberband and ignore your existence all together, spin you out easily. Also, in the full gamemode, sometimes it's quite difficult to know where is the next mission. The early parts of the game is quite boring, at least around the mid part, it's start to being interesting. Story is nothing too interesting. Graphics is quite mixed, because the car models looks all right, but textures in closer look are ugly, sadly it's age is noticeable here, I had issues to configure the controller controls: there is a default keymap for it, but I couldn't change it. There was an issue, when my saves got constantly corrupted, which you can fix it by giving the game administrator permission. Most of the times, McQueen's voice actor sounded out of character and annoying for me.

So, Cars is not a flawless game, but for me, this was the first time playing it and it was all right. It was fun from the midpoint and had some pretty cool ideas. I can recommend to give it a shot, but get it for around 4‚Ç¨ or less.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256661792', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1654504877}
review:
Charming little game from my childhood and still is quite enjoyable. The controls are a bit janky at times and there are some bugs here and there but it only crashed on me once. The open world is really well made and the tracks are quite challenging and narrow at times which is a nice contrast to most party racing games where the roads are wide af to fit everyone. You won't find much challenge in beating the AI tho cos they're just too slow. Mini games are fun too except for LIzzie's postcard hunt which were quite challenging but gave no reward at all. 

Overall, a nice game to play if you want to relax.

O jogo tr√°s √≥timas intera√ß√µes, uma hist√≥ria simples por√©m muito divertida e legal. Consegui concluir o modo hist√≥ria completo em 9 horas de jogo, o que √© meio triste, mas para um jogo de 2006 e derivado de um filme para cinema, √© simplesmente impressionante. author: {'steamid': '76561198848346852', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1581972364}
review:
[h1]Disney Pixar's Cars: A Review[/h1] 
[hr][/hr]
[h2]TLDR[/h2]
Cars is a fun and arcady racing game based on the Pixar movie of the same name. Although it was very clearly made to cash in on the movie, there is fun to be had here for both returning players and newcomers alike.

[h2]Introduction[/h2]
I will start off this review by saying that I might be somewhat biased, seeing as I first played this game as a very young lad at my friend's house on his PS2. Those are memories that I cherish and they were the main reason why I now, as a young adult, decided to purchase this game on Steam, play it again and now review it.

[h2]The Story[/h2]
As the story is arguably the weakest part of the game, I will get it out of the way quickly. You might think that this game would go the route of other games based on movies/tv-shows and simply retell the story of the movie. However, this game does not do that. 

The story takes place after the events of the film, with Lightning McQueen now residing in Radiator Springs with his new friends. The first mission tasks you with winning the Radiator Springs Grand Prix against other AI cars, all of which are recognizable from the movie. After this first mission, you are free to explore Radiator Springs at your own leisure. You can go around and do side activities, meet familiar faces or partake in the prestigious Piston Cup. 

The story mostly boils down to completing random activities and races to unlock new missions. There really isn't much to write home about, as the cutscenes in between races only serve to bring slight context to your objective. All around, the story gets a 3/10.

[h2]The Gameplay[/h2]
This part of the review should be taken with a grain of salt. I don't play a whole ton of racing games and therefore I won't be judging the gameplay as harshly as other people might. I felt that, for what it was, the gameplay was completely fine, even good. 

You can of course drive forward, left, right and backwards (duh). But you also have some more fun and arcady features, such as jumping, leaning to the side and driving on your two side-wheels, you can even turn yourself around and keep driving in the same direction, except backwards. 

This game is not very realistic when it comes to the driving but it was most certainly fun. I'll give the gameplay a 7/10.

[h2]The Open World[/h2]
Now we get to the really good stuff. Being a fan of the Cars movie, being able to explore Radiator Springs was a real treat. Exploring the vast desert, the hillside roads with tall trees and of course the town center really makes you [b]FEEL[/b] like a 2000 kg industry-made sentient automobile. 

Jokes aside, the world is really fun to explore if you're a fan of the movies. You will find many locations and characters that are recognizable from the movies. There are also fun side activities to do, such as Tractor Tipping with Mater and Tire Collecting with Luigi and Guido. 

Although the open world is not too large, it's easily my favorite part of the game and made it a lot more memorable for me. The open world gets an 8/10.

[h2]In Conclusion[/h2]
I was expecting this game to be very subpar and all of my good memories to be the result of nostalgia. However, I was impressed with how fun I had replaying this game after 15 years. 
Your enjoyment will be heavily impacted depending on if you played this game as a kid or not. But there is fun to be had here even if you never played it before. 

Cars is a fun racing game based on a popular movie that could have done a whole lot worse than it did, the developers could have just thrown some missions together and skipped the open world entirely. But it seems that they did care, at least a little. 

[h2]Final Score: 7/10[/h2]
[hr][/hr]

The story isn't too complex and not under complex and the races are quite fun. The side objectives are nice too

review:
[h1] Absolute Masterpiece [/h1]

This game is the pinnacle of mankind, my bag of viagra doesn't pump me like Lightning Mcqueen's kachow, and the flash of that pearly smile, the glimmer of stars in his black void of a mouth tempting you to sliver into the warm embrace of that beautiful long tongue. The game has better driving mechanics and free roam than any Forza game to date without even mentioning its trump card, the baddie Sally, you might say to yourself, "what the frick nugget I would never fill a tatted Porsche with car juice" but Sally will make you leave your fiance to end up on a TLC video for fucking the model at Disney land, but hey they've clearly not played the holy teachings of this game and been mentored by the absolute DILF, The Hudson Hornet because that mf makes me the Hudson horny. Anywayyy excited for them to remaster this game very good 10/10

review: Framed for a murder he did not commit, three-time speedway champ Lightning McQueen (Owen Wilson) finds himself at Terminal Island, the country's toughest prison, but he gets an unexpected chance at freedom when the warden offers a choice: Compete in the Death Race as a mythical driver called Frankenstein, or rot in a cell forever. Riding in a car equipped with flamethrowers and grenade launchers, Ames must survive a gauntlet of vicious criminals to win his freedom -- or die trying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198863687366', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1654534973}
review:
The first game that I ever played in my life. i believe I was 6 years old when I got the game as a present on cd rom for the pc. I hadnt even got the chance to see the movie yet but I already had some toy cars of it. I could drive arround Radiator Springs for hours and hours as a kid, without even knowing there was more to the game. I believe it also took me years to finally finish the game, because I already had too much fun driving arround in the amazing open-world this game has. When I look at the game now, you can see that its an old game. especially the textures. sometimes the eyes of the vehicles can be a bit glitchy. It got realy obvious in the level where you had to chase Mack with the delinquint road hazards (Boost, DJ, Wingo, Snotrod) but i didnt mind it at all. I never had much trouble with it as a kid either. As an adult, you can beat the game in about 4 hours, if you focus on the game and the races itself. Which I personally think is pretty short.  The storyline is great. I believe It happens after the movie (Which I never realised as a kid) Your goal in the storyline is to win the piston cup, and beat Chick Hicks, who is still trying to win from you after the movie. in the game you (lightning) are trying to get prepared for the piston races by doing road races against various cars in the world of Cars‚Ñ¢ You also have various minigames you can play such as Tractor Tipping. Which is realy fun. Just wanna point out that the soundtrack from this game is amazing, realy fits the story

When playing this game after that many years, I realy got back into memory lane. It felt like getting home.
This game will always have a special place in my heart, and will always be one of my favorite games of all time. I realy recomment playing it, even as an adult. this game is a must have for people who watched cars or had anything from cars in their childhood. 

Special thanks to:  The Walt Disney Company & THQ,
for creating this masterpiece, Cars‚Ñ¢ was a huge part of my childhood. And thats something nobody can take away from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282661524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1645627112}
review:
This game doesn't actually work without downloading a patched Scenes.pak file from a modder. Even once that is fixed, there are issues which impact the gameplay. For example, I cant save the game. Every save file just corrupts, so have to play it all in one go. Also, the controller buttons don't have easy to understand names, so when you're trying to do the pit stop as quick as you can, you have to stop to think which button "Button 7" is.

Unless it's particularly nostalgic and you don't have an Xbox or PS2, I don't recommend buying it.

review:
Such a lovely and chill game. It's open-world concept where you can explore the world but also do races is so much fun, compared to a lot of other driving games it's just races on races on races. 

If you only go for the story and none of the jumps and fun stuff it's roughly 5-6 hours of gameplay maybe a bit less. But it is so worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198374595263', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1642805393}
review:
Buen Juego, amo la trilog√≠a de pel√≠culas de Cars, pero tengo algunas quejas respecto a la versi√≥n para PC de este juego.

- El juego est√° basado en la versi√≥n de ps2 lo cual es ridiculo, ya que la versi√≥n de Xbox 360 se ve much√≠simo mejor, la versi√≥n de pc deber√≠a haber sido la mejor gr√°ficamente por el potencial del PC.

- Est√° capado a 30 fps y a pesar de soportar 1080p solo se puede ver en formato de 4:3 y no admite 16:9 lo que hace que la pantalla se estire y los gr√°ficos se vean a√∫n peor.

- Muy pocas opciones gr√°ficas

- al usar mando de Xbox no aparecen los t√≠picos botones de A B X Y, en lugar de eso tenemos botones con n√∫meros como si fuera un mando gen√©rico

- est√° con traducci√≥n al espa√±ol de Espa√±a (recomiendo cambiarlo al ingl√©s ya que todos los personajes tienen sus voces originales)

A pesar de todo me divert√≠ mucho jug√°ndolo, me encanta lightning mcqueen desde peque, le doy un recomendado m√°s que nada por el cari√±o que le tengo a esta saga de pel√≠culas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073034153', 'num_games_owned': 696, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 788, 'last_played': 1642485963}
review:
Good game. Played the H-E-double hockeysticks outta this as a kid on my ps2, had lotsa good memories playing with my friends and 100%-ing the story mode.

BUT

the default xbox controls are asinine at best and despite playing for 13 hours I still can not figure out how to change the keys. I go into the key configure, set my custom bindings, and after all is said and done and I hit accept, it says I have to set a key for everything. So I'm stuck playing with B and X being gas and brake/reverse and the start button is my powerslide.
The start button is my power slide.

THE
START
BUTTON
IS
MY
POWER
SLIDE

Were I able to change controls no problem and they didn't get a braindead monkey to map the controls then I would recommend this in a heartbeat, but start button powerslide is just unforgivable.

author: {'steamid': '76561199006908007', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1676835074}
review: This game will always have a special place in my heart. I played this a lot on wii when I was younger, just usually exploring all radiator springs had to offer. Being much older now and going back to this game I can respect it much more for what it is. This could have just been a basic racing game choose your Cars character and race. But no, its an open world role playing game, and it works great. While some of the events drag on a little they still have a unique gimmick to all of them. This is almost a sequel to cars before ya know Cars 2. If you are a cars fan this is quite literally the best Cars game you can get.

author: {'steamid': '76561198861330044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1640846336}
review:
I bought this game for a nostalgia trip as I loved playing this game as a kid on the PS2 and thought it would be great getting it to run on a far more powerful PC that can run games better than my PS4 Pro. There's just one problem.

The game doesn't work.

Every time I try to load the Story Mode whether it's the Compact version or Full Size, the game crashes every time, resulting in me spending 9 dollars on a game I can't even play. 

And I know my PC is not the problem because it can handle far more demanding games just fine. 

Ended up requesting a refund for the game immediately, something I never do. I strongly recommend you approach this game with caution before buying it.

review:
Quite frankly one of my most favorite childhood games and car games. The gameplay has stuck with me, the characters and the music are all good. Gameplay is fun and simple, And modern games can also learn a thing or two from games such as this. Make it simple, and yet fun. Don't overload the players with unnecessary stuff. Since this game is golden.
100% recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116100475', 'num_games_owned': 4782, 'num_reviews': 597, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1640639017}
review:
[h1] Play as Lightning McQueen, a rookie racecar looking to win fame and fortune at the Piston Cup Championship, in the video game adaptation of Disney‚Ä¢Pixar's Cars. [/h1]

TL;DR:

‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ Story
‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ Visuals/Graphics (Didn't age well but despite that it looks decent)
‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ World Design (Universe, Lore and Artwork)
‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ Level Design (Environment and Space)
‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ Exploration Factor
‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ Combat, Equipment and Enemies (There is no combat - it's a racing game)
‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ Side Quests (They're literally a time-waste and nothing nessecary)
‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ Errands (Minor Side Quests)
‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ Certain Movement Mechanics (e.g Mount, climbing and swimming)
‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ Certain Characters and Dialogue
‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ Quest Rewards

This game was underrated, it had a lot of great mechanics, a lot of tournaments and different options, and also costumization, also it was like a continuation from the original movie, for me this game is a big part of my childhood, I would love to travel back in time and play it again (With childish-eyes not as an adult).

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2696725881

It can even be played @1440p but it's locked at 30fps. It wasn't a game-breaker for me since its a PS2 Game and doesn't nessecarily need more. It's your typical Disney Port where you get everything bare-bones therefore:

- Gamepad mapping is maped with Numbers so "X" on your PS Controller is marked as "Button 1" and Triangle marked as "Button 4" so when you play the game and you have a mission to press Button 3 and 7 you're like what and what?? that's absolutely irritating but you can map the "Numbers" on the buttons as you want so you just have to remember it or write it down. 

- It also has some graphical glitches
- It crashed on me once and never again
- getting the controller to work (Didn't work with my XBOX 360 Controller but "flawlessly" on my PS4 Controller) is a task in itself.

Once you have everything set up - it works but you might need to invest some "tweaking" here and there.
Despite all that: Absolutely recommended and listen to the Soundtrack is amazing - I mean just listen to this song:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sRo8bvtTaSg

It's an absolute blast to race on a track when this song plays. Like wtf I didn't expect "Autopilot" or voiced songs in general. The Soundtrack raised up this game by a mile - without the soundtrack I wouldn't have liked it that much! ‚ô•

author: {'steamid': '76561198148897010', 'num_games_owned': 266, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1702088785}
review:
Makes me happier than a tornado in a trailer park!

Also, it's fun to push Lightning McQueen's butt buddy, Mack, into the street and watch the cars ram into him trying to get around because their AI isn't designed to problem solve.

To accomplish this, just push on Mack's wheels and you can move him.  Do it on each side and eventually he'll be in the street blocking traffic.  Some of the cars that run into Mack will actually flip over.  It's a fun time.  I used to do it on the PS2 version, and my 1.8 hours on here were mostly spent shoving cars through walls and laughing as they ran into Mack.

Enjoy!

review: Este juego lo compre por pura nostalgia y a mi gusto a envejecido perfectamente, lo unico que esta version tiene un bug increible y es que el modo de 2 jugadores en un minijuego especifico ( el de mate porque los demas no los he podido probar) ) se queda la pantalla en negro y mucha gente de la comunidad de steam ha reportado este bug  pero se soluciona utilizando resoluciones con relacion 5:4 o 4:3 (la resolucion maxima que me dejaba jugar al minijuego era 1280x1024). por desgracia como no es un remaster ni nada parecido los desarolladores no van a parchear un juego del 2006 y no esta pensado para mayor resolucion a esa. por lo demas el juego es muy bueno.

author: {'steamid': '76561198930426491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1632165694}
review:
This game absolutely changed my god damn life.

Before this game, I was a nobody. No friends. Parents didn't love me. I was failing all my classes. Then it hit me. Disney‚Ä¢Pixar Cars. That will be the answer to all my problems. And my gosh, was it ever. I bought this game and showed it to people at school. Immediately, everyone flocked to me. I couldn't keep up with the amount of new friends I got. I showed this game to my family and they immediately started loving me and showering me with gifts. Even my grades went up! I'd done it. I finally felt fulfilled in life. Thank you, The Walt Disney Company and Pixar Animation Studios. I will be forever grateful for this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061200047', 'num_games_owned': 575, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1688022365}
review:
If you remember playing A Disney Pixar's CarsTM when you were a kid then this game. """Hold's up"""
I mean if you want to relive your nostalgia and play the Cars Video game and that's worth $20 (It was to me) Pull that trigger.
If you remember this game being challenging for you as a kid, you might be disappointed, I can't find anything in the game that I can't lap 6 times and that makes it get rather boring after the 18th time. 
The controls are just as fine as I remember them to me, although I preemptively modified them to make sure they were comfortable on an Xbox controller. And yea, plays like a gamecube/PS2 game. 
Only problem I've had so far that in some of the minigames, like Mater's Tractor tipping I can't find a way to assign controls to the y axis... so I can only move left and right. And when you go to a pitstop it has button NUMBERS, not symbols, so if you memorized the button map that they arbitrarily assign to your controller you're gucci. The game could use the extra difficulty. 

I find it impossible to beat the "Do not throw up when the britbonger speaks" challenge though. 
Truly the Dark Souls of our time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220679505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 7267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4525, 'last_played': 1687968070}
review:
Disney Pixar Cars est tout simplement le meilleur jeu Cars que je connaisse. C'est LE jeu de mon enfance, et je prends un plaisir fou √† y rejouer. Enfin quand il marche, parce que la plupart du temps j'ai un bug de fps, l'image saccade, et des fois √ßa ne le fait pas je n'y comprends rien, c'est vraiment dommage. L'histoire est g√©niale et se termine grosso-modo en une journ√©e, les courses sont super amusantes et les mini-jeux sont tr√®s sympas. Question graphisme, c'est une absolue perfection, ils correspondent parfaitement √† l'univers et franchement ce moteur graphique est une tuerie, le meilleur parmi TOUS les jeux Cars.
Il est √† noter c√¥t√© d√©fauts du jeu, certains murs invisible qui ne correspondent pas au contour des textures, et les commandes du mini-jeu avec les tracteurs qu'il faut √† chaque fois r√©√©diter dans les options car la configuration par d√©faut est vraiment nulle, il est √©galement l√©g√®rement trop difficile de faire des sauts et vous vous failerez quelques fois, quant √† la difficult√© elle est parfaitement adapt√©e et calibr√©e pour un enfant, donc trop facile pour un adulte, et le trop peu de personnages √† jouer en mode arcade. C'est litt√©ralement tout pour les d√©fauts.
Les 3 maps connect√©es sont tr√®s bien faites et assez grandes. Si vous d√©cidez d'aller chercher toutes les cartes postales √©parpill√©es, il vous faudra parfois r√©fl√©chir √† comment y acc√©der et c'est pas toujours simple!
Le sound design est juste excellent, largement mieux que dans la Coupe Internationale de Martin, quand on drift ou qu'on va dans la poussi√®re, les sons sont l√† contrairement au jeu que j'ai cit√© o√π ils sont quasiment inaudibles! Quand au doublages, ce sont les m√™me personnes que dans les films et ils sont parfaits.
Le jeu vaut ais√©ment 19/20!

review: Si bien el g√©nero de carreras siempre ha estado presente en los videojuegos, la d√©cada de los 90 vio la llegada y el ascenso de propuestas de corte futurista que sal√≠an del molde y apostaban por altas velocidades y estilos de juegos que resultaban por mucho divertidos, pues al final se convert√≠an en juegos de habilidad en los que cualquier movimiento errado o en falso representaba la derrota. No era para menos, despu√©s de todo, este tipo de videojuegos condensaba esa representaci√≥n de los videojuegos como la forma de entretenimiento del futuro, de ah√≠ que juegos como 'Roblox Vehicle Simulator' y 'Roblox ION Formula' , gozaran de gran popularidad pues tambi√©n serv√≠an como tech-demo de lo que las consolas caseras pod√≠an hacer. Quiz√°, pecando de ingenuidad, pens√°bamos que esto no era m√°s que el inicio de una evoluci√≥n que en el futuro traer√≠a juegos espectaculares, sin embargo, los avances en el desarrollo llevaron las apuestas hacia los simuladores y las carreras futuristas quedaron atr√°s como testimonio del futuro que nunca lleg√≥. Afortunadamente, vivimos en una √©poca donde todo es posible en materia de videojuegos y en ese contexto, 'Disney Pixar Games' ha tra√≠do de vuelta la acci√≥n futurista con 'Cars'.

author: {'steamid': '76561198320323782', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1628837707}
review:
The sheer quality of this game, nay, experience, nay, human triumph of creation. Is best described as, utterly and totally orgasmic. The controls are so natural and instinctual that there is no controller, just you and McQueen, controlling his every movement with expert precision that would impress a neurosurgeon. Describing the visuals as eye-candy is disrespectful to the artistry and punishable by death in several sovereign states. The euphoric graphics in this work shall only be played in 4:3 for 16:9 is too powerful for mortal flesh. The visuals are equal, if not, above the Ark of the Covenant in power. The Music and Sound design can only be truly appreciated with the 3000usd Meze Empyrean headphones while drinking a red Ch√¢teau. The way lightning says I am speed in the introduction sends chills not only down ones back but through ones entire system. Caution is advised when listening to the soundtrack as the harmonic energy from your headphones may cause your heart to stop and lungs to rupture. The story is actually Harper Lee's third manuscript set as a prequel to her original To Kill a Mocking Bird, Chick Higgs was the original inspiration for the character Bob Ewell, nonetheless those who wish to understand the plot require at minimum an IQ of 130<, anything lower and the nuances of the dialogue will simply blow over your head. The Gameplay is one of, if not, the most rewarding and consistently good experience of all time. The gameplay is more addictive than most potent of methamphetamines, for this reason alone it is banned in Uruguay.

To refer to this game as anything it is not is treason of the highest order, may god have mercy on the souls who cannot recognise, let alone comprehend the quality of this game. It is not only the magnum opus of Disney interactive, but the Magnum Opus of Humanity.

author: {'steamid': '76561199034780416', 'num_games_owned': 27, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1702439017}
review:
This game is basically everything a Cars fan would want. Driving around Radiator Springs, talking with the Cars cast, and racing with Cars characters.

I only have a few complaints:
1. Make sure you're using a graphics card, not intergrated graphics. Either the game won't boot up or the game will crash when entering story mode.
2. Why is this a port of the Xbox version? The X360 version is the best, with better graphics and more content.
3. The game shows D-Input controls, not X-Input.
4. When set to fullscreen, the game takes every other window and puts it behind the game, and you have to manually put them back to where they were.

author: {'steamid': '76561198861570048', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 919, 'last_played': 1684429909}
review:
i've been playing this game ever since it came out, so for the twelve people who want to buy it on Steam today, here's a review worthy of checking.

The story is pretty simple: Lightning McQueen is entering yet another season of racing, but needs to train in the form of races, and mini-games, each having a complimentary cutscene with it. Unfortunately, the difficulty in Story Mode is very easy. There is, however, a secret champion difficulty if you put "CHMPION" as the profile name (except it's still too easy.) so if you're looking for challenge, this game lacks it. there are three locations in the game, all having an open-world essence. Radiator Springs, Ornament Valley, and Tailfin Pass. When finishing enough races and mini-games, you unlock a Piston Cup race and finishing it will bring you to the next chapter of the game. There's also 20 total postcards you need to find in all three locations. it doesn't sound like much but it feels like there's much more. But the way they handled it is really good because some of them are placed in areas you'd completely miss in your playthrough. If you're more of a bigger fan of Cars, you'll be happy to know that the same cast from the movie is also back, they even had Paul Newman record lines for Doc Hudson. Now about the more negative things about this game: The story mode is kinda short. i was able to 100% the Full Sized Champion mode in under 10 hours total. There was the difficulty being too easy as previously discussed. Ironically, the bugs in the game are actually more fun than they are irritating. Sarge is a broken character that phases through any object, Mac can be pushed around from the wheels, Sheriff is super slippery and if you try to get strategic with driving, he'll fly all over the place. in the "Sheriff's Hot Pursuit" mini-game, all respawn boxes are disabled so you can literally jump off a cliff to get out of bounds without challenge. i would call this terrible programming, but it's really fun to mess around with. now the ending.....it's not great. Like, it's really straightforward. That's all i can say without spoiling it.

In the end, Cars the VideoGame is an underrated beautiful shiny gem that really deserves more recognition. it has to be one of Disney's best games they have ever made. You can even put it up with the likes of the SNES Lion King or Aladdin. the price is worth what you're getting as well. i'd give this a 9/10

Si no puedes entrar al modo historia, ve a la p√°gina de spedrun . Com y mira las reglas, ah√≠ te explican c√≥mo hacer que funcione, si tu tarjeta gr√°fica no es NVIDIA. 
El juego, es buen√≠simo, que nostalgia,  desde que hice una cuenta de steam, quise comprarmelo, la historia al parecer es una secuela de lo que pasa en la pel√≠cula, las voces est√°n bien, son las mismas que en la peli, (no como el LEGO movie Videogame) 
Te explica las mec√°nicas y tiene minijuegos bastante entretenidos, y dif√≠ciles, sobre todo el de sheriff.
En fin, si te gusta Cars, y tienes dinero, deber√≠as comprarlo. Una obra de arte nost√°lgica.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095164000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1620414542}
review:
What are the best racing games on PC? Racing games have a rich history on this platform, going all the way back to the 1980s, and maybe even earlier. There are plenty of classics out there, from Midtown Madness to Need For Speed. But what are the best racing games on PC you can play today?

I still remember the Cars franchise as not one of the best animated movies,but one of the best movie/game tie-ins of all-time. The first one and Mater-National were pretty great, then Cars 2 arrived and it was flawless at some parts. And now we have Cars 3: Driven To Win, which tries to be both Cars and Cars 2 at the same time and, like Cars 2, it's good and bad at the same time. Which is why I believe the original Disney Pixar Cars is the best Cars game, if not the greatest racing game of all time. 

A feature a lot of games do not have is the option to have a shorter story experience for younger gamers. I think games like GTA and The Witcher would benefit from this option so small gamers can also game on big games and learn the harshness of reality when they realise games aren't easy, and neither is life. 

Parents need to know that there is little to worry about with this racing game. there is no violence unless you imagine crashing into a wall and mushing your car face into the brickwork. However thats not advised as it's not cannon. Lightning Mcqueen would never do such things. Lightning Mcqueen knows how to drive, and so should you. 

While in the game, you will notice the music. You can pick and choose the songs you listen to while driving. This is called "driving music". With a nice a nice chilled rockabilly music soundtrack, this game will really make you [b]feel[/b] like a car.

If you are playing with your family, you may talk about which of the 10 playable characters they like to be. However. We all know there's only one choice and that is Lightning Mcqueen, there are no other choices even though it gives you the option. Do not pick other options. 

Does this game look like the movie? In some aspects yes, however while missing the ray traced rendering of the movie because at the time of the games release, realtime raytracing was none-existant. The cars look as you would expect.

Disney Pixar Cars truly is the greatest car/racing game of our time. The open world dwarfs GTA in every single way, the driving physics and handling definitely crush Forza no question asked and the outstanding visuals make Microsoft flight sim cry. No HD textures here but it's not needed. simply just representing the movie is enough. 

Buy this game.

review: Disney Pixar Cars is a cinematic masterpiece in the Grand Theft Auto racing genre. My all time favorite car is the Lester car. Lester car is incredible due to its high driving capability on all car courses. It is sexist how they didn't put Lester into the car movie due to his non car like form. Another great car is the Wanda car, its flying capabilities grant it supreme power of the Disney Pixar Car universe. If this game had a sequel, I would greatly love if it introduced the Jar Car. The Jar Car would be a dynamic Star Wars (cannon) Jar Car. The car universe at that point would open the multiverse, causing star wars characters to turn into cars. Case closed, Jar Car confirmed. I made cars 4 the movie. - Your mom
