author: {'steamid': '76561198372463874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1663223712}
review:
This game saved my life.

I am 27.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561199135282341', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1711308584}
review:
I love this game its my favorite game of all time, I tried it on other consoles but when I tried it on here there are some problems with this version.
1. There are no shadows for computers
2. Graphics are about the same as the PS2
3. Tractor Tipping controls are awkward (At least for me)
4. With certain types of cars the camera is so close that you need the camera on chase mode
5. There are some texture errors
6. Eyes can be weird sometimes
But there is some good things about this version
1. The loading is sooooo much more faster
2. You can customize your own controls
But all and all I think its okay :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198310849852', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1708135170}
review:
This is easily one of my favorite games of all time. As a massive longtime Cars fan, I grew up with this game so I will obviously have some bias towards it, but I know the general consensus is that this is a good licensed game. And I have to agree, it's a darn good one. Maybe not enough for me to pour literally tens of thousands of hours into this game and its two sequels, but it's still a really good time. While I may have only recently gotten it on Steam so it may not show much time, I know I will be pouring lots and lots of time into this game in the future.

The game has a basically perfect recreation of Radiator Springs for you to just drive around in and mess with the characters from the film, as well one of the reasons why this game is so great: it introduced new characters to the Cars franchise, and not only that, a lot of them were actually cut characters from the original film. Plus, every single cutscene had to go through an approval process by Pixar, so they will at least be somewhat quality. They were really happy to help with the game as a whole too, they would often lend ideas to the team, and I'm assuming they're the main reason why every single voice actor from the movie is back for this game.

The gameplay is really fun outside of one or two major issues. There's races of all kinds throughout the game in various locations, such as demolition derbies and monster truck races, and even some very fun minigames like the ones that involve the Delinquent Road Hazards stealing Lightning's stuff and then he has to try to get back, which I honestly wish was done a bit more during the adventure. The biggest problem I have the game is how easy it is. I know I said earlier I've been playing these games for over a decade and a half, but I don't think that means I should be 30 seconds ahead of all the other racers. I suggest naming your file CHMPION to make it slightly better, but still not by much.

Skipped out on a lot for this review, but overall easy 10/10 I'm obviously not biased. (But in reality to the average person who isn't a huge Cars fan, probably a 7-8/10. Still good and worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070388544', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1612431080}
review:
I'm on Win10 with AMD graphics and it ran completely normal. I have not had a hiccup with this game since download. Played with xbox controller.

Good game for cheap. Got for about $2 from keyshops. 

Played for the amount of time shown which I think is a good average. I did all side missions except the post card one because that one is just boring hunt. One thing to make sure to note before playing is that this game doesn't really help you with progression. Mechanics are fine, racing is fun, some events are good. I wish I could just play as other characters in the story mode than just in the mini games but whatever... Still fun if you have played this as a kid or just a casual fan of Cars. If not, then this is probably not a game for you.

New players:
To know your progress look at the map for the chapters. Certain events will be white on the mini map meaning that there is a new thing there. To prolong gameplay, get points for skins and to unlock characters in the "bonus content" section in the main menu. I missed this during my playthrough and was disappointed there were only 3 skins for lightning, finally found it after googling.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118859217', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1693827058}
review:
Me ha sorprendido gratamente encontrar este juego en Steam. Lo jugu√© har√° unos 15 a√±os en PS2 en casa de mi primo peque√±o y nos lo pas√°bamos en grande con las carreras cooperativas (y vaya tela intentando encontrar las postales), as√≠ que la nostalgia es un punto a favor para este juego. Pero sin remitirme a ella enfocar√© la cr√≠tica a jugadores que quieran adentrarse en juego de Cars.

No es de extra√±ar que este juego sea de CARRERAS. S√≠. Ese es el factor principal, pero NO EL √öNICO. El juego consiste en hacer una serie de carreras con los otros personajes para ir desbloqueando nuevas carreras en Radiator Springs y carreras de la copa pist√≥n, a medida que vas aprendiendo nuevas t√©cnicas (superderrape, turbo). El juego consta de un modo libre, cuyo √∫nico objetivo ser√° ir recogiendo las postales (de la misi√≥n de Las Postales de Lizzy), acceder a la ubicaci√≥n de las misiones e ir recogiendo Puntos Rayo por todo el mapa, los cuales podremos gastarlos en nuevos personajes, pinturas de coches, bocetos y escenas eliminadas del juego. Tambi√©n ganaremos Puntos Rayo por determinadas t√©cnicas de conducci√≥n en las carreras.

A parte de las carreras, el juego ofrece un par de minijuegos divertidos, un modo arcade donde revivir las carreras (tanto por la Ruta 66 como la Copa Pist√≥n) y el mismo modo pero Contra, donde podremos jugar con un amigo.

[h1]7/10[/h1] IMPORTANTE. El juego puede crashear ya que actualmente no soporta Windows 10, lo suyo ser√° que lo ejecut√©is en modo compatibilidad con Windows XP (yo lo tengo con XP Service Pack 3). Esto har√° que se inicie como administrador, lo cual impedir√° que se realicen capturas de Steam. Si el juego llegara a crashear es altamente probable que se os corrompa el savegame y se os borre la partida, as√≠ que iniciadlo cuanto antes as√≠. Tambi√©n destacar que es un port de XBOX 360 y no incluye los botones de un mando est√°ndar (se pueden bindear los botones, pero aparecer√° como Bot√≥n 1, Bot√≥n 2...).

Espero que en el futuro veamos m√°s de los cl√°sicos de Disney Pixar, pues me encantar√≠a jugar a ambos juegos de Los Incre√≠bles.

it's also fun to speedrun, if you're into that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047647334', 'num_games_owned': 536, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1583483726}
review:
I used to play this game growing up, and comparing it to the movie as well as other licensed games, I must say it holds up pretty well. 

Just as I remember, this game is an open world driving/racing game follows the events of the first movie & aren't actually canonical, which is a shame, because the story for Cars 2 actually wasn't anywhere as entertaining as the one in this game. This game is a better sequel than the sequel Pixar actually delivered, at least until Cars 3 came out.

There are numerous locations to explore, many different challenges and a surprisingly good selection of unlockables & licensed music. No matter if you're buying this for your kid or to revisit for some quick nostalgia, this game is actually worth $20. I'm surprised to say it, but this is one of the better examples of a licensed game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169941966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1609462774}
review: I quite fondly remember this game in my younger years. Maybe about 5-9, sometime around there. It was fun going to GameStop with my mom and seeing all the pre-owned PS2 games in their yellow sleeves. That was so exciting for me as a young lad. This game and two others do I distinctly remember. S.W.A.T, Transformers: The Game, and of course Cars. I'm pretty sure I just free roamed not even caring about the story. I was so enthralled when going by the A. I and hearing their little quips. I have to thank Cars for the music they had. My favorite being Free Ride by the Edgar Winter Group. Just an amazing song that led me down a path to discover much more classical music. I read the reviews claiming that the game would not work on newer systems. That did not stop me though! I had to try to relive the magic I felt for this game! Like a charm, this game fired up with no hiccups! Instantly I remembered everything. I played the game for a while, but like any nostalgic filled memories I found out how lackluster this game is. To be fair, I have played many more great games since this one. Which invariably most likely changed my view. The game is boring honestly. Not enough excitement for me anymore. Though to my 1 digit-year-old self, this game was a masterpiece. Maybe I should have kept it that way. Maybe I should have listened to the reviews. Nevertheless, this will stay in my Steam library as a good memory. I am not sure if this will work on all systems, but it could be worth a shot. I cannot promise you will like it if it does work. Be wary. I am still going to give this game a thumbs up for the good memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091375452', 'num_games_owned': 678, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1609327384}

author: {'steamid': '76561198861537144', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1674838253}
review: The Cars one game is the only good one out of the three. The games take a similar path as the movies, the first one is amazing, the second one is passable but ultimately not what I wanted, and the third is garbage. This game is way beyond its time, and still fun today. Sure, there are some bugs with playing this game on Windows 10, as it was made in 2007, but overall, its performance is still very acceptable, the minor bugs don't ruin the gameplay. I'd give the Cars one game a 9/10, as it is both very fun and a worthwhile experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312906924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1673825668}
review:
[h1] Great game [/h1]
but first...
[b] If you're having problems running this game on your Windows 10 PC, try updating your system. If your system is up to date and you're still having issues, go to the game's local files (C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Steam\\steamapps\\common\\Cars) and find the exe file (should be "Cars.exe"). Then go to its properties and use the compatibility mode (Windows 7 or lower). Also try setting it to run as administrator. If it still doesn't work or you can't find the file (unlikely) try checking for missing files through game's properties in the Steam library [/b]


Onto the actual review:

As you can probably guess, I have played this game in my childhood. For there is a sale now, I decided to buy it for myself and check if I'll still have so much fun playing it after all those years. Honestly, I wasn't disappointed. I finished it in one sitting (main story). Game plays great, the story's engaging enough to keep you racing and better, dialogues and side characters are fun, side missions are quite fun. The locations are well designed, driving model is very arcady but good. Puts you well in the world of Cars. Only things I can complain about is questionable crash physics, rather low difficulty level (it's a kids' game so it's forgivable, definitelly try setting your profile name in-game as "CHMPION", it will increase the difficulty quite a bit) and outdated graphics (they still hold up quite well with the cartoony style). I'd recommend buying it on sale, 20 bucks is a little much for a 14-year-old game. Great game if you're looking for something for your kid to play, if you wanna refresh your childhood memories of playing it or if you wanna buy a game for a person interested in the Cars franchise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134394966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1609169041}
review:
DIE Zeitmaschine zur√ºck in die Kindheit!

Ich kann mich den anderen Spielern im Bewertungs-Bereich nur anschlie√üen-
dieses Spiel kauft sicherlich niemand, um damit ein aktuelles racing game zu bekommen ...

Auch bei mir ist es der Nostalgie wegen, aber sowas von!
Ich glaube, das war eine ziemlich kluge Idee, das game auf steam auch noch heutzutage anzubieten, denn scheinbar
holen sich das Spiel auch heutzutage noch Leute- und das ist auch gut so!

Beim ersten spielen wurde ich augenblicklich in meine Kindheit vor √ºber 10 Jahren katapultiert- und es hat sich gut angef√ºhlt!
Das Spiel l√§uft wie damals, eigentlich ohne Probleme, aber hier und da gibt es glitches und man merkt, dass das game kein mega gro√üer Titel sein sollte wie bspw. Most Wanted zu damalig gleichen Zeit.

Aber darum geht's auch nicht. 
Ich war damals ein gro√üer Fan vom Film Cars und ich kann mich bis heute nicht satt sehen an der Landschaft und Umgebung- es macht wirklich jedes mal auf's neue Spa√ü, die Gegend auf eigene Faust im freie-Fahrt-Karriere-Modus zu erkunden- Orte die im Film nur kurz angeschnitten wurden kann man sich hier in Ruhe und in aller verf√ºgbaren Detailgenauigkeit anschauen.

Die story macht aber auch Bock, wenn man die nebenbei auch spielt. 
Ich verbinde bis heute sehr viel mit dem Spiel, ich glaube das war eins der ersten Spiele, in die ich als Kind richtig eintauchen und die reale Welt ziemlich ausblenden konnte- das game ist echt sch√∂n zum abschalten :)

Nat√ºrlich bedenken, es ist ein game von 2006.... da kann man eigentlich nicht wirklich was erwarten... Grafik ist aber noch ertragbar wie ich finde :) es ist halt wirklich was f√ºr fans von erster Stunde (:

author: {'steamid': '76561198325166374', 'num_games_owned': 58, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1706629344}
review: Absolutely would recommend. The driving is very relaxing; although the car physics can be buggy if you try to make them buggy. The story isn't actually that bad, and many of the races aren't super easy, particularly if you crank up the difficulty. The only real downside is that you can't play as certain bonus characters, such as Mack, DJ, and Boost, like you can on the PS2 and PSP.

review: As I looked out my window, I pondered. Could the perfect game possibly exist? I paced the length of my room anxiously, biting my finger nails and wistfully nibbling the end of my half mooned spectacles. By this point, all of youth had drained away, leaving a dry and shriveled husk of manhood that had blossomed from a depressing year. I sat at my desk, at my wits end, when I heard it. "wow" says the soothing voice of Owen Wilson. Then I knew. Cars The Game (2006). Like God descending from Heaven to create his Adam, I fired up Steam and found my divine purpose. After descending the ludicrous asking price of $20, to a much more reasonable $6.99, my year was salvaged. I dropped into the wondrous world of cars yet again, like a veteran soldier on the battlefield, and felt joy no man has felt since the debut of the 2006 cinematic masterpiece of the same name. Heed this my children, Cars The Game is pretty okay, but not for $20.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090382657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1606488931}
review:
First things first, make sure you read the Discussions on this game for the major crash fix solution. Second there are two minor yet annoying issues this game still suffers from once the crash fix has been applied. First there's the screensize issue. The game does not save the settings properly so you might have to go to settings and adjust the size a couple of times to get it fixed. Second is the saving issue where you might unlock something in the main menu but then quit and when you load back in, the things you unlocked are locked again. Easy fix is to load up story-mode after unlocking and then save. Those are the quick fixes.

Now as far as the game itself goes, I played this game a lot when it first came out for PlayStation 2 back in the mid-2000s. As movie-tie-in games go, this is actually one of the best ones I've played. Solid gameplay with a great soundtrack, great graphics for its age, and even features the original voice cast including Owen Wilson as Lightning, Larry the Cable Guy as Mater, and even the late Paul Newman as Doc Hudson.

It's a simple and straightforward open world racing game set in the world of Cars, primarily focusing in and around the town of Radiator Springs from the movie. However, this game takes place AFTER the first movie and focuses on the Piston Cup Racing Season after the movie. Chick Hicks is still the main antagonist in this game in that he's trying to prove that he can beat McQueen in even a fair Piston Cup Season. 

Most of the game though will involve participating in a series of road races around Radiator Springs, typically 3 lap races with a handful of end-to-end races scattered among them. There are also 12 lap Piston Cup races to participate in but only as a limited roster with some characters being restricted to certain race types. For instance you can't race as Mater in the Piston Cup races while you can't race as Strip "The King" Weathers in the road races (Side note, The King is voiced by Richard Petty himself too). Over the course of the game you unlock a nitro boost ability for Lightning, eventually increasing the amount of nitro which you'll need to complete certain races later in the game. You also unlock the ability to flip your racer around to drive backwards like Mater.

The graphics might not be the best but for the mid-2000s they're pretty good. Barring the aforementioned bugs, the game is still just as good as it was back in the day. Again, be sure to check the discussions for advice on how to fix any issues.

Today I was very excited to play this game,I bought it,enter in the story mode,stayed 1 sec and than the game crashed,after that I watched some reviews on steam and searched on google to see if I can solve this problem...can't run on windows 10...what a surprise,the thing is..we are in 2020 and this problem is from 2015....2015,I like this game a lot,but if you are on windows 10,dont buy it...because it wont run,buy Cars:Mater National,this will run on windows 10 :)

EDIT:

-The problem got fix and we can all play now!

author: {'steamid': '76561198970231763', 'num_games_owned': 25, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3011, 'last_played': 1703476272}
review:
Title: A Thrilling Ride through the World of Cars: A Review of "Cars: The Video Game"

Rating: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ

"Cars: The Video Game" brings the beloved characters from the animated film franchise to life in a thrilling and immersive gaming experience. As a fan of the "Cars" movies, I was excited to jump into the driver's seat and explore the vibrant world of Radiator Springs and beyond. While the game has its flaws, it manages to capture the essence of the films and provides an enjoyable racing adventure for players of all ages.

The first thing that struck me about "Cars: The Video Game" was its impressive visuals. The graphics are colorful, vibrant, and faithful to the animated movie's art style. From the iconic characters to the detailed landscapes, the game truly feels like stepping into the world of Lightning McQueen and his friends. The attention to detail in recreating familiar locations like Radiator Springs and the Piston Cup racing circuit is commendable.

The gameplay itself is fast-paced and accessible, making it easy for both younger and more casual players to pick up and enjoy. The variety of racing events and challenges keep things interesting, with options such as standard races, time trials, stunt challenges, and even mini-games. The controls are responsive and intuitive, allowing for precise handling as you drift, boost, and power-slide your way to victory.

One aspect where the game falls a bit short is its overall depth and longevity. While the single-player campaign offers a decent amount of content, including different race types and unlockable characters, it can feel repetitive after a while. The story mode follows a linear progression, and although there are side missions and collectibles to discover, they don't significantly extend the game's lifespan. Multiplayer options would have added more replay value and increased the game's overall appeal.

Despite its limited depth, "Cars: The Video Game" remains a highly enjoyable experience, especially for fans of the movies. The game's soundtrack complements the action-packed races perfectly, featuring familiar tunes that add to the immersion. Additionally, the voice acting, provided by the original cast, adds an authentic touch, making you feel like you're interacting with Lightning McQueen, Mater, and the rest of the gang.

In conclusion, "Cars: The Video Game" captures the spirit and charm of the "Cars" movies while delivering a fun and accessible racing experience. While it may lack some depth and replay value, its impressive visuals, enjoyable gameplay, and faithful representation of the beloved characters make it a worthy addition to any fan's collection. Buckle up, rev your engines, and get ready for an adventure on the virtual racetrack alongside Lightning McQueen and friends.

review: Cars the video game is a childhood game for many people, the movie and this game holds many memories for me and i've had a blast playing it. This game is more than just racing, you get to explore, uncover secrets, and see all the characters personalities, and i love that the same actors from the movie came back and voiced the same characters. I would give this game a 4.8/5 and i think other people should play it too.

review:
Its a good first rally game for kids. The controls are quite simple and the physics are basic enough. The graphics are adequate and it runs smooth.

One thing that put me off at the beginning was that it crashed every time I started a race. I had to manually tell the OS to use the external video card and not the built in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050681478', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1573457043}
review:
Don't let the crashes discourage you.

The steam version has a solution in the community hub. You only have to replace some corrupted files in the game (This usually works for a lot of people) and run the game in Windows XP compatibility mode. 

Other than that, this game is really nostalgic for a lot of 2000s kids. I used to play this a lot on my PS2 back when I was in 5th grade. I'm not sure if the steam version have 2-players splitscreen like the consoles version, but overall, this is a very great and basic family-friendly arcade racing game. (It's really fun to re-live the good part of my childhood again).

author: {'steamid': '76561198339415223', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 20392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3771, 'last_played': 1705849351}
review:
Rating: 8/10
Positives:
"The game is just almost perfectly, seriously. I never get bored of this game, even when i finish the story mode. The game is also fun, you can play your favorites characters like: Mater, Sally, Doc Hudson, and etc. Plus the Free-roam is just awesome.

The plot of this game is just very nice. You can even play Piston Cups just like in the First movie, which is even awesome.
The game is easy to play, i haven't seen anything being difficult on any events, On some of the cutscenes, the dialogues could also be funny.


Bugs:
Though the game does has some bugs and crashes, like the infamous one where the game crashes when you either enter in Story Mode or Arcade. Thankfully though, there is a fix for that. You can go to my Discussion post, which is easy to find. It will tell you how to fix it, so you can enjoy playing Cars.

Another infamous bug, on Tractor Tipping. If you don't turn off the "Automatic Re-Center", and if you have finish all the levels. Then for some reason, the game thinks that the player has turn off the "Automatic Re-Center". But in reality, the Player still has that on. And no you can't just turn it off and turn it on again, because this won't fix the issue. The only way to fix this, is to create a new profile. And start all over again, So turn off the Automatic Re-Center. Before you could start Tractor Tipping. (NOTE: This bug also happens with Mater-National, which they didn't fix it.)

This one is my favorite, select any mini-game events on Arcade. Once you select one, pause the game. Then press Switch Event, now change the type to Mini-Game. And then change the Level to Sheriff Hot Pursuit, (it could be any levels) and instead of getting Sheriff. You actually get McQueen instead XD, which is why is my favorite for this bug.

Negatives/Logics:
Well, the price on steam is just ridiculous. I mean, 16,79‚Ç¨ just to buy Cars? Seriously? I will recommend for you to get it on sale, which i got it on Sale for just 5,87‚Ç¨. Although it will take a while for it to be on sale.

The Mini-games, nothing wrong about them, But there are few mini-games to talk about like. The "Doc's Lesson: Powerslide" is just way too short, and it could be done in just under 1 minute.

Also, the "Lizzie's Postcard Hunt" is just... goddamn worst. Seriously, couldn't there just be a Level. INSTEAD OF GETTING THEM IN FREE-ROAM? But my question is... How the hell did the others Postcards went from TF or to OV. Or better yet, how does McQueen even carry's Postcards with him? He doesn't has anything with him, does he magically puts Postcards in his Mouth or something? Jeez, i know this is meant to be a game. But i'm just wondering how McQueen could do all of this having nothing with him to carry Postcards, or how others Postcards went from TF or to OV again.

When your playing in 1:69, the camera angle is just... bad. I don't know how to explan it, but the camera is just too close to a character. just use the 2nd camera instead.

Some of the events/races could be little confused, like Ornament Valley Circuit is an example. On the second cutscene, it starts on the opposite road. And then it changes the way which... it doesn't make sense.

On High Speed Heist, when you play as Wingo. He got about 5 boxs with Lightning stuff (which i will talk about it later), but on Lightning Strikes Back. When McQueen said that he is going to get them after them who stole his Boxs stuff, but when McQueen drives away. Where does he even go to? There is a block road when McQueen made a left turn and went straight ahead, there is no way that McQueen could have avoid the block road. And now onto the Highway, remember when i said about that Wingo got about 5 Boxs with McQueen stuff in it? Well, for some reason. they have 12 BOXS INSTEAD OF 5, Seriously. they got like extra +7 for no reason at all, and how the hell do they even hold the boxs? When McQueen hits one of them. The Boxs comes out of nowhere, is like the box comes inside of the body car. And then it comes outside for some reason, this makes 0 senses."

Anyway, this was a longest writing to actually post on my review. Which i'm too happy lol, (although it took about 5 hours to write and thinking also) so see ya bois.

author: {'steamid': '76561198862521591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1669885408}
review:
I got this game back in 2007-2008 and I got it again yesterday for nostalgic experience. :) I totally got it! 4 hours of pure Openworld, collect points, racing and collecting postcards nostalgic :D It obviously got glitches and bugs but those are excusable with its age. But there is one downside. I played it for 4 hours and then closed it. When I wanted to open it again the player-profile had an error and wasn't playable again. Sad. I tried fixing it, restoring it and googled but its corrupted now. I've seen cases of the game not starting with Windows 10 and I've been so happy that it worked, but YIKES now it's broken and I have to play it all again. Not the biggest problem but frustrating. 

Is it worth the price? Not for the prices on Steam. Find your old CD, buy it second-hand or get a key. It's too likely that you can't even play it on your system or encounter a corruption like I did and I just think that 16‚Ç¨ is too much for that. Is it worth the nostalgic gameplay? YES! It's one of the best Cars games that ever came out and I'm so glad I could play it again. :')

happy racing!

review:
This is pretty fun, has an open world to run around in, race events, side quests, all kinds of good stuff! Has just about all the main characters from the movie, thlugh you play as Lightning McQueen. Gameplay is pretty easy, works well with my Logitech Dual Action and my DualShock4 controllers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119291556', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1577816466}
review: Catchao! Good old game that brought back a ton of nostalgia for me. When i saw this had come to steam, as well as some other old but great games, i bought it to play it again without the hassle to set up the PlayStation2. If you're looking for the same experience you used to have with this game, i can ensure you that you will. Plug in a controller and you wont feel a difference. Even without a controller, it feels a lot like it used to. Sort of high price for these old games, but nothing you cant spare if you've been craving to play them ever since your PS2 days. If you're now wondering, the other classics are: Finding Nemo, WALL-E, Brave, Planes, 4 other cars-games, and some other less known disney games from the days.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108557278', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1535833283}
review:
This is one of the mosty shoddy ports I've come across yet. I played this on PS2 in my childhood, and picked up on Steam hoping to have an easy way to record footage for a video (thankfully I got it on sale for only $5). First off, the game crashes as soon as you go into Story Mode if you haven't forced the game to run on Nvidia (or something similar) instead of integrated graphics. Secondly, gamepad support is awful. It's not enabled by default; can only be changed on the main menu. I also hope you don't mind that there's no button icons as you're going to get input prompts like "Button 5" for Boost. The game is also obnoxious when it comes to Fullscreen. There is no Window option, and focus CANNOT be torn away from it... 3 Finger Touchpad Slide... Home Key... Ctrl + Alt + Del... Nothing minimizes the game. The cherry on top of this is the fact that last night, I made a save file. I went to open it up today, and was greeted with a lovely "This profile appears to be damaged and cannot be used.".

This isn't a must play game in the first place, so you're fine ignoring it and never thinking about it again in your life, but if you REALLY want to play it, I reccomend just getting it off eBay/Amazon or something if you have a console to use it on. Only get this version as a desperate last resort, and do it on sale like I did.

If it's any consolation, the sequel, Mater-national is also on Steam, and is much more stable than this. The only issue it shares with this game is shoddy gamepad support.

author: {'steamid': '76561198298670299', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1690034171}
review:
czym jest ta gra ?
jest to jedna z wielu gier opartych na bajkach/animacjach dla dzieci, tym razem oparta na animacji auta z roku 2006. W grze sterujemy Zygzakiem Mcquenem, naszym celem jest wygrywaniem kolejncyh wy≈õcig√≥w za kt√≥re otrzymuje punkty w postaci z≈Çotych t≈Çok√≥w (osony kt√≥re oglƒÖda≈Çy auta wiedzƒÖ co to jest ale dla tych kt√≥rzy nie wiedzƒÖ to powiem, ≈ºe z≈Çoty t≈Çok to puchar kt√≥ry otrzymuje zwyciƒôsca serii wy≈õcig√≥w samochodowych w Stanach Zjednoczonych) gra ko≈Ñczy siƒô w momencie kiedy wygrywam fina≈Çowy wy≈õcig w Los Angeles i zdobywamy puchar ( to tak w skrucie na czym polega gra)

+Dobrze zrobione modele postaci

author: {'steamid': '76561198231392296', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 84258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 438, 'playtime_at_review': 935, 'last_played': 1712434266}
review:
I can't truly describe how much I love this game and how absolutely amazing it is. But it's actually one of the best games I've ever played. The hours counter I have is not lying, I literally played this game for 1K+ hours. No AFK, no hours grinding bullshit. Pure gameplay and that's it.

Yes, it's a buggy mess of a game, but how amazing the story, characters and gameplay is with the physics makes this game an absolute blast. The game might seem really clunky at first, but if u say so u haven't played any other cars game. This is the peak no other cars game will overcome in terms of physics and driving control. 

If u think it's not worth ur money - trust me, it does. U can download the cracked version, but the risk of getting the worst experience possible is way higher than with steam version. Steam version is the goat and i've seen a lot of people having absolutely stupid problems with the cracked versions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198322047346', 'num_games_owned': 9, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 175, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1711822024}
review:
Compatibility issues with Windows 10? Start the game and navigate to the graphics settings and change anti-aliasing from "None" to "4x":
Main Menu > Options > Game Options > Anti-aliasing > 4x.
Hit Enter to apply the change. Now racing and story mode should work fine.

review: This game was a big part of my childhood. For a game, I will admit it's not that good. But as a piece of nostalgia, you will definitely get your money's worth. I had the problem most people have, where it crashes when you start the story. I read somewhere that the fix was to get an Nvidia graphics card. And now on my PC with a gtx 1060, it works! So get it, if it doesn't work on your pc, then refund it. And if you are really set on playing this game, then make sure your next PC has an Nvidia gpu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198310817486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 2115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1669394220}
review:
Great nostalgic game :)

Cars is open world and has a good number of races, minigames, and collectibles. Some of the more fun events - like chasing down the speeders - and some of the offroad races have high replayability.

It can take a while to find the location of all those stamps, and even then, getting to them is a whole other challenge. I remember for two of them you have to climb a huge mountain with its own share of difficulties and pick which stamp of the two to get. They both involve long jumps to reach them, and if you fall, you have to climb back up the mountain all over again.

You can also send the NPCs flying if you drive into them at around 180 MPH... I sent Wingo off a bridge and he disappeared into the low-res texture zone.

There's random unintended things that happen that make the game amazing. I hit the side of a rock wall going 170 and I went flying into the air over most of the map and landed in the loading zone for Radiator Springs... You can also clip through almost any fence that connects to a rock wall by driving fast into the connection.


Also, the game starts up perfectly fine for me. I don't know if I just got lucky or it's an issue for certain hardware.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144212261', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 852, 'last_played': 1596860127}
review: A great game that I enjoy. I remember playing this as a kid, and I was excited when I recently found out that it was available on Steam. This game has great races and mini-games. The controls can sometimes feel floaty and weird, but it is easy to get used to (I used a PS4 controller). The hub world, consisting of Radiator Springs, Ornament Valley, and Tailfin Pass, give you this sense of exploration. Not to mention you can hit npc cars in these hubs which can be very hilarious if you are doing this with someone watching you. You can choose a difficulty before starting Story Mode, which are Rookie, Pro, Champion, and another mode that is the most challenging that you need to unlock (I don't know how to unlock it or the name of it). The cutscenes have original voice actors. You can also get bonus content like characters (note: unlocked characters can't be used in Story Mode), paint jobs for characters, art, deleted cutscenes, and other videos, but you need to pay with points you receive in-game. The characters you unlock can only be used in Arcade and Multiplayer. Arcade is where you can choose a character and paint job and choose any mini-game or race that you have unlocked while playing in Story Mode. Multiplayer is basically just Arcade but with multiplayer. Multiplayer is split screen, and there is no online play. The only downfall is the sometimes floaty and weird controls that can take some getting used to and the difficulty that keeps on switching from easy to difficult, then back to easy and cycle repeats. Overall, it is a great game that anyone can enjoy, and I am more than happy to call it one of my favorite racing games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120790053', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 230, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1509899265}
review: Bisogna ovviamente valutare il gioco per i suoi anni. Lo giocai su PS2 ai tempi ed era davvero fantastico, a parte il doppiaggio un po' modificato rispetto al film (almeno in italiano), rimane un gioco fantastico per i fan del film disney. Non solo gare, anche tante piccole missioni e minigiochi. Adatto per i pi√π piccoli ma anche per gli adulti nostalgici.

review:
Nice little game full of nostalgia if you played it as a kid already!

The story is very cheap and leans a little bit on the movie.
The races aren't challenging at all, but quite fun, because I personaly think the tracks are good designed.
There is a quite big world (for 2006) to explore!

author: {'steamid': '76561198058146871', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1499190104}
review:
Es gibt eigentlich nur einen Grund, das Spiel heute noch zu kaufen: [b]Nostalgie[/b]
Ich glaube nicht, dass irgendjemand an diesem Spiel gro√üe Freude haben wird, wenn er es nicht damals schon gespielt und geliebt hat. Denn auch wenn ich in den Grafikeinsteillungen meine Bildschirmaufl√∂sung in FullHD ausw√§hlen konnte (wo ich nicht wei√ü, ob das damals auch schon m√∂glich war?), wirken viele detailreiche Texturen (besonders Lackierungen) wie Pixelbrei. Die offene Spielwelt an sich ist jedoch grafisch erstaunlich gut gealtert und sieht an vielen Stellen sehr gut aus f√ºr ein Spiel aus dem Jahr 2006. Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist so gew√§hlt, das auch kleinere Kinder im Grundschulalter die verschieden Rennen und Minispiele packen k√∂nnen - also keine gro√üe Herausforderung f√ºr Erwachsene. Die Geschichte ist nicht wirklich mitrei√üend, denn die Zwischsequenzen dienen meistens nur dazu, einen Grund f√ºr das folgende Rennen oder Minispiel zu finden ohne gro√üen Zusammenhang zueinander.
Von der technischen Seite gibt es zumindest bei mir (Win 7 64bit) keine gr√∂√üeren Probleme. Am Anfang hatte ich das Problem, dass die angeblich fehlerhaften Spielst√§nde nicht geladen werden konnten. Nachdem ich jedoch in den Kompatibilit√§tseinstellungen "als Administrator ausf√ºhren" ausgew√§hlt habe, laden die Spielst√§nde ohne jegliche Probleme. Nur die Sprecherstimmen in den Zwischensequenzen sind manchmal leicht asynchron und/oder abgeschnitten.

Alles in Allem bleibt mir nur zu sagen, dass mir das Spiel nach Jahren der Abwesenheit wieder gro√üe Freude bereitet! Einfach durch die verschieden Gebiete cruisen und sich an die gute alte Zeit erinnern - Das sind mir die 4,99‚Ç¨ absolut wert!

author: {'steamid': '76561198274296955', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1689534620}
review:
I have one main word when it comes to this game: NOSTALGIA!!!!! No, seriously! This was one of my favorite Gamecube games growing up. Although I did grow up with the norm for these like Super Smash Bros. Melee and Super Mario Sunshine, I usually go unique and play games like this and MAN is this good! I remember a lot from when I was growing up and playing this again brung it all back! This is an open world game that is also a racing game. Think of the Crash Time series, but more for kids. In the game, you start a prologue race that takes place in Lightning McQueen's dream. As you probably guessed so far, this is based on the movie by Pixar (more specifically, it takes place after, and does it well) and I am not the type of person who are like, "Des gam ez bezd on moove, muzt suk," or something like that, and this game is further evidence. After Lightning's dream, you start the game for real, and you get so many options for play. You can do normal races, minigames, a side quest like thing where you collect stamps, and even Piston Cup races once you get enough Trophy points. In game, you can get regular points that act as a currency to buy things for the Arcade and 2 Player modes as well as some secrets.
 Now I should go in detail. Normal races are just that, races. You go pass people, do jumps, find shortcuts, and use boosts once you get them. Minigames can be anything from Tractor Tipping, a stealth like game, or collecting tires with Luigi, where you collect tires. This game has variety so far, and we have one more mode to go, and that is the Piston Cup races. These are more like NASCAR races where you go in an oval at high speeds. In the middle of a Piston Cup race (only in Story Mode) you do a pitstop minigame where depending on the time, you can get a good speed boost, but the inputs can get confusing since they show the button number and not what the number is. Now, a good game can't be complete without some great music, and this game delivers! This game features old time music with modern twists (modern as in around 2006). Seriously, 2006 was the time for great video game music. Yes, even for Sonic 06. I mean, c'mon, you HAVE to admit the game at least had an awesome soundtrack. To make this soundtrack even more amazing, it even has licensed songs for it's style. I really recommend listening to the music on YouTube is you can or even buying the soundtrack that is licensed. 
 Now, I praised the game like crazy so far, but like everything, it has issues. First, the games graphics are based on the Gamecube graphics and not the XBOX360 graphics. That may be fine since it makes me more nostalgic, but this just seems weird. Also, this version seems to be emulated since there can be some graphical errors found, mostly in character's eyes and on certain textures. Like I said earlier, since the button's number is displayed and not the actual number, you can sometimes get confused, normally in minigames that don't use the normal controls that you mapped (in fact, when I started, the numbers confused me so much, I got my steering reversed, as in I somehow got my lefts confused with my rights. Don't ask). Also, the game is easy as heck. Once you get in first place, you basically won since you go too fast and end up like, 33 seconds ahead of 2nd. However, these are more minor things and the good HEAVILY outweighs the bad. I recommend this to everyone, especially people who grew up with the game on consoles. I got this from the Disney Mega Wave 2 (or whatever it's called) and it was worth it! This game is godlike and is perfect for racing game beginners and people who want a good local multiplayer experience.

Update/edit: I commented about the graphics that way because I did not fully scale them. When I made this, they were only at 800x640. Now that I fully scaled them and turned on the Anti-Aliasing (Whatever that is) I can say the game looks incredible fully upscaled.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258586841', 'num_games_owned': 44, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1493643582}
review:
I remember playing this awsome game at 6 years old in 2008. Was the best game out there. However, i am not able to relive those fond memories as the game crashes when you try to select story mode. So it looks like my memories are going to have to stay memories. I have tried evrything like compatability mode and adjusting settings. Wish Disney could have fixed this but looks like I'm going to have to get a refund :(
However, after a bit of fiddling about and entering a cheat code i unlocked all tracks and found out that for some reason it's the initial tracks and story mode that makes the game crash. Looks like more detective work is needed!

author: {'steamid': '76561198240411244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 834, 'last_played': 1688583378}
review:
Wow... This game is just fantastic. When I first got this, it was my piece of junk PS2 that had a really hard time reading discs, making it really hard to play for longer than an hour. But over 10 years later, with it on my computer, it's even better than I remember. Let's start with some positives:

The game is excellently designed. I never found one track that I deemed unfair or too difficult. Even the Piston Cup races were a ton of fun, and that's saying a lot for tracks that are just straightaways and then a left turn.

The free-roam is awesome. Seriously, I can drive around the HUB worlds for hours and not get bored.

Now onto some negatives:

Unfortunately, I can't say the same for the minigames. Some like Sheriff's Hot Pursuit, High Speed Heist, and Lightning Strikes Back are at best OK, but others like Tractor Tipping and Mater's Backwards Lesson get way too hard for their own good, and Doc's Lesson: Powerslide is just way too short. Also, Lizzie's Postcard Hunt is one of the worst scavenger hunts I've ever had to go through in a video game.

The control can be kind of awkward sometimes. I occasionally found myself just being flung against the wall for no reason, not turning as sharply as I wanted to even though I was powersliding, and it can just feel really slippery at times.

Now this is just a nitpick (and it might just be my computer), but a lot of the textures, mainly the eyelids on the characters (especially Mack), will start flickering at random. The framerate will just suddenly drop at random as well, but again, this might just be my computer.


Overall, Cars is a great racing game that definitely worth the ¬£15, and even though it does have a lot of problems, I think you should try it if you haven't already.
My rating: 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198160328317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1577043210}
review:
Story: The Game picks up after the Movie Ends, As Lightning McQueen You must get ready for another Piston Cup Season.  Now with The King Retired it's Chick vs McQueen this time Around.  The story is basic & very forgettable, But hey, At least I have won all the Piston Cup Races. (6.5)

Gameplay: THQ & Rainbow Studios made this game a free roaming Open World environment Which is Awesome, But the Controls are weird.  There are Unlockable Mechanics such as Turbo, Powersliding, Tilting, & BACKWARDS DRIVING LOL, Sorry, I had to.  Then again, This game is a Racing game, So there are alot of Races.  (8)

Graphics: The Car Models are Really good, But the textures look Low Quality.  The Map of Radiator Springs, Ornament Valley, & Tailfin Pass look Really good too.  I also love the Game excllusive Characters.  (7)

I'm glad this Game Worked on my Computer.  And I also have the XBox 360 Version.

Final Score: 8.5/10 (Good game, But Lacks some of that PIXAR Magic that made the Movie Great.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198325319145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1471800430}
review: Having played this game extensively when I was eleven to thirteen, when I found out that the game was available on Steam, I just had to get it. However, there is something terribly wrong: the game isn't compatible with Windows 10 which prevents me from playing it at all. It will load with no problem whatsoever, but once I select to play story mode or arcade mode, it will load for about two seconds before finally crashing. I have done this with the same result three times already. I really don't want to give this game a negative review for two reasons: I loved it when I was younger and I haven't played it on this platform yet. But I am left with no choice. I would like to ask for a refund for the game (a full twenty dollars), but I would rather see this game be fixed so that I can be able to play it again, because it is a really fun and interactive game. Hopefully, something is done about this and I, along with other people having this problem, can play it soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163386590', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 7980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5662, 'last_played': 1696020719}
review:
[h1] My favorite childhood videogame of all time. I remember when i first played it way back in 2006 when i was 5 years old. Now to the parts which makes this game very nostalgic to me and WHY is my favorite one. [/h1]

[h1] 1.Open World [/h1]
[b] This one is pretty obvious,i loved this since i was a kid because at that time I had a PC that was really trash which was only able to play some games,and this game was one of them. I loved to explore the town and the other 2 parts which are Ornament Valley and Tailfin Pass. There are no rules in this open world like Need For Speed but i guess it`s a kids game so i can see why. [/b]

[h1] 2.Soundtrack [/h1]
[b] The music is really amazing,it plays all the time,including in free roam,which it`s sequel doesn`t.Anyway,if you want to record this game there are a lot of non-copyright songs so you can still have them enabled but be sure to disable the other ones.Other than that,the music its pretty enjoyable,and hypes the player to continue playing the game. [/b]

[h1] 3.Characters [/h1]
[b] This game returns the original cast from the movie like Owen Wilson,Bonnie Hunt,Larry the cable guy etc. which is very nice.Also it includes a lot of new and interesting characters which you will like and gives more variety to the game. [/b]

[h1] 4.A.I [/h1]
[b] If you are used to racing games in general,this one will feel so easy,i mean its way too easy to beat the A.I,they show no competition,and sadly you can`t choose their difficulty in Story Mode which is a pity. Even on Arcade mode,they are still easy to beat on the hardest difficulty which is Champion difficulty.So yeah,this game has the worst A.I in the franchise.
But they are like that because this game was made for kids in the first place,so i kinda understand that,but at least,they could let us choose the difficulty,but nope they didn`t. [/b]

[h1] 5.Story [/h1]
[b] The story continues after the first movie,its pretty good plot actually,you are doing races,minigames and Piston Cup races as well. I like it,but depends on the person if they like it or not. [/b]

[h1] 6.Controller Support [/h1]
[b] The best thing about this game is that you can play with a controller which is easier than with a keyboard. [/b]

[h1]And now 2 things that are the worst about this game: [/h1]
[u] The frame is capped at 30 fps which really sucks,also this game working on your PC is random,even when you have the minimun requirements. [/u]

[h1] Despite the flaws that it has I`ll give a Overall Score 10 out 10 [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198105594775', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1608767803}
review:
Have to copy this to help inform as many as possible that this game DOES WORK.

"Ok so here's how I fixed it to get it running (windows 10)
-find the main cars.exe and right click on it
-select properties
-go to compatibility mode
-click "Run this program in compatibility mode for:"
-select windows 98/windows me
-apply"

This game was the first I ever really loved and im starting to realise why I fell in love.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085726117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1450922982}
review:
So far no crashes. I have been running it in adim with the old compatablity mode. So if you are wondering does this work. Well mine does on a 4790k,980ti, 16gig ram, and Win 10.
 Game play is good and is an upgrade to the consoles unlike Cars 2.   
 Graphics are older but ok However! This game runs at 30fps with no option to turn it off and crashing into things always gives a slight pause in the hub world. You should check out Mater National if you are interested in this. Most of the game is the same but it does not support widescreen. Though it is 60fps! with much better textures. More hub world and new tracks. I perfer over this older verion.
 That being said the story and racing is all very good. The hub world is also a nice touch. 
 I still recommend this game because it is fun. And that is the most important thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047012994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1562353445}
review:
Played the game with my son about 8 years ago and we both loved it. Pure nostalgia. Alas, the game does not work on Steam. Can't quite figure out how Steam can distribute a game that does not work on their platform. 

I refunded the game and got my money back - I'd rather have the game, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114757810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1619963761}
review:
Here's what I did with this game;
1) I saw it on sale and it made me look back at the good PS2 days when I was 9.
2) After a long time, I decided to buy it
3) After downloading it I realized it didn't work (as most of the community reported with the same problem)
4) I started crying (just saying, I didn't literally cry) because I couldn't play this awesome game.
5) I took my PS2, and played it.

This game is splendid but the Steam version is just useless. Don't buy this (Unless they fix the problem, which is more likely to be impossible)
PS2 version 9.5/10
PC version -3/10
